conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will be teaching you how to conduct research today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は調査の進め方についてトレーニングします。

conversation.en_sentence: Like just searching online?
conversation.ja_sentence: オンライン調査みたいなものですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes and no.
conversation.ja_sentence: それも含みます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: First of all we need to make sure the sources are legitimate.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、出所が正規のところであるかどうか確認しないといけません。

conversation.en_sentence: So no blogs or editorial?
conversation.ja_sentence: ブログとかコラムなどはだめということですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのとおり。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The first place I would look at is government websites.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初に見るところは政府のホームページです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They typically have accurate data that is trustworthy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府の数字は、一般的に正確で信用性が高いものです。

conversation.en_sentence: What other websites would be good?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に良いサイトは？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can also check out major institutions like banks, accounting companies, and market research companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大手の銀行、会計事務所、市場調査会社などの企業データも活用できます。

conversation.en_sentence: Why those?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They are well known and typically publishes good market reports.
conversation.ja_sentence: こうした企業は有名で、たいてい質の良い市況報告を発行しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But some market reports aren't free.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、市況報告は無料でないこともあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So stick to the ones that are free.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、無料データで探します。

conversation.en_sentence: What if it seems the report is useful?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、もし、有料データで良さそうなのがあったら？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can consult with me then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私に相談してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But a lot of the research you will be doing is preliminary research.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、君がやるのはほとんど予備調査だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it won't be presented to upper management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣に見せるような調査ではありません。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Would there be cases when we would purchase market reports?
conversation.ja_sentence: 市況報告書を購入するようなケースはあるのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We will need them when we conduct detailed feasibility studies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 詳しい実現可能性調査をするようなときには購入が必要になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: These will be presented to the upper management so we need to show that the information is validated by professional third-party companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: そういう調査は上層部へ報告されるので、専門の第３者企業に認証された情報でなければなりません。

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben, it's nice to see you again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、こんにちは、またお会いできて嬉しいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nice to see you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそお会いできて嬉しいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Business has been good?
conversation.ja_sentence: ビジネスの方はいかがですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's been a bit slow with the holiday season but that's normal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 休暇のシーズンでちょっと活気がないですが、それが普通です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Again thank you for coming in today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はお越しいただいてありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to discuss the proposal you sent me last week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週送って頂いた提案についてお話したかったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the one regarding the market research.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、マーケットリサーチに関する件ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I reviewed the contents internally and felt that it wasn't quite something we were looking for.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社内で内容を検討したのですが、ちょっと我々が求めていたものとは違っていた感じがあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you be a bit more specific?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう少し具体的にお話して頂けますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We were hoping that the research will cover more topics in depths.
conversation.ja_sentence: リサーチがもっと多くのトピックを掘り下げるのを期待していました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But it basically covers information we already know.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかしおおむねすでに私たちが知っている情報をカバーしていました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Were you expecting more field work like interviewing companies?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社への聞き取り調査など、もっと実地調査を期待されていましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: If that's the case, the cost structure for our service would be different.
conversation.ja_sentence: その場合、私共のサービスの料金体制が変わってきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it won't be a flat price?
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは一律料金ではなくなるということですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: It will be a combination.
conversation.ja_sentence: 組み合わせになりますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: So there will be the base price plus a monthly retainer fee for the duration of the field work.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから基本料金の上に、実地調査を行う期間中に月々の依頼料がかかります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Also, travel expense and a daily meal allowance would have to be covered as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、旅費と毎日の食費もかかります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about you give me another proposal with that cost structure so I can discuss it with my boss.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上司と話し合うので、その料金体制で別の提案を出して頂けますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I can whip that up quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、すぐにご用意できます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think I can get you a revised proposal by the end of the week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 週末までに改訂した提案をお渡しします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大変ありがたいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please send it to us as soon as you can.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早く送ってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, thank you for coming today.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、今日はお越しいただきありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the opportunity.
conversation.ja_sentence: 機会を頂き、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: This is Ben speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben this is Dennis from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、こんにちは、A社のデニスです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hi Dennis.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、デニスさん、こんにちは。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How have you been?
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気でしたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've been good thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気にしていました、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When was the last time we talked?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最後にお話したのはいつでしたっけ？

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think it was around two years ago when we renewed your insurance.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２年ほど前に御社の保険を更新した時だったと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうでしたね。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I'm calling in regards to that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日お電話したのもその件なんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh is it time for a renewal already?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、もう更新の時期ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I just wanted to ask if your sales volume will be increasing in the next year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来年御社の販売量が拡大するかどうかお聞きしたかったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That will factor into calculating the insurance rate.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが保険料を算出する要素になるんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You mean for our export business?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちの輸出事業のことですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes that's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we are doing around four million in sales right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、現在の販売高は400万ドル前後です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We anticipate that will increase to six million next year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来年は600万ドルに拡大すると見込んでいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think we can get a discounted rate?
conversation.ja_sentence: 割引料金にしてもらえますかね？

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You guys haven't had any insurance claims since you started.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社はこれまで一度も保険請求をなさっていません。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: So you guys would be deemed low risk.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまりローリスクとみなされるんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think I can get you guys a lower rate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 割引料金をご提供できると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは素晴らしい。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll get back to you next week in regards to the rate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 料金に関しては来週またご連絡いたします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: デニス チョングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Goodbye.
conversation.ja_sentence: さようなら。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Bruce.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ブルースです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you come to my office?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと私の部屋に来てくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll be right there.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、すぐに伺います。

conversation.en_sentence: You wanted to see me?
conversation.ja_sentence: お呼びでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, have a seat.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そこにかけて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm actually doing a presentation at an event and will need to introduce our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: あるイベントでプレゼンをやるんだが、うちの会社の紹介をしなくてはいけないんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's happening next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが、来週なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I was reviewing the presentation you made for me earlier this year and realized that it needs to be updated.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年既に君が作ってくれたプレゼンを見直していたんだが、書き換えが必要なところがあるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、もちろんできますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you check if there's a new version of the company presentation from the administration department?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社プレゼンの新しいバージョンが総務部から出ているか調べてくれるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they usually post new ones on the internal website.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大抵ホームページの社内コンテンツに新しいのをアップしています。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll check if they have an updated one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 更新版が出ているかチェックしてみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: There's also some changes to our assets since the last presentation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前回のプレゼンと資産の数字も変わっているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, there have been some changes with selling off assets and acquiring companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、売却資産と企業買収のところに変更があります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send a list of changes for the presentation.
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンの変更箇所のリストを送るよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That will be helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: それだと助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can make me a draft by the end of today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日帰るまでに原稿を仕上げられる？

conversation.en_sentence: I think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: できると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: It's just adding and removing content so it should be quick.
conversation.ja_sentence: 内容を加えたり削除したりするだけなので、すぐできるでしょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me know when you finish.
conversation.ja_sentence: できたら知らせてくれ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'll send over a draft as soon as I finish.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、原稿ができましたらすぐにお送りします。

title: General Chatting: Set up a meeting with Government official

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, can you do me a favor?
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさんこんにちは、頼みごとをしてもいいかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I need you to arrange a meeting with someone from the government.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府の方との会議の手配をして欲しいのだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there a specific person you want to see?
conversation.ja_sentence: どなたか特に面会したい方はいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking for someone that can give us advice on subsidies for research and development.
conversation.ja_sentence: 研究開発の助成金についてアドバイスをくれる人を探しているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I want to see if there are any government programs that we can use for our project.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々のプロジェクトに使える政府のプログラムがあるか知りたいんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I think there might be some government-run programs that provides grants.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多分助成金を支給してくれる政府主導のプログラムがあると思うんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I know someone in the government so maybe he can direct me in the right direction.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府に知り合いがいるので彼が適切なアドバイスをくれるんじゃないかなと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll leave this to you then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では君に任せるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Try to see if you can arrange a meeting for next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週会議ができるか調整してみて。

conversation.en_sentence: Or even the week after.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは再来週でもいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。

conversation.en_sentence: Who will be attending from our side?
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社からは誰が出席する予定ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It will be Ben and myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさんと私です。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, maybe you should join too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君も参加した方が良いかもしれないね。

conversation.en_sentence: Since you are the one arranging the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会議の手配をしているのは君なんだから。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。

conversation.en_sentence: I will keep my schedule open.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、予定を空けておきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, I'll let you know once I can confirm this meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく会議が確定できたらお知らせいたします。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me know when you do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認が取れたら教えてくれ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, show it to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、見せてください。

conversation.en_sentence: So, what do you think?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、どう思われますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's working.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、できてますね。

conversation.en_sentence: So you did this by adding that?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、それを加えてこうしたと？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I had to run it through a solution and then heat it though, otherwise it won't emulsify.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、溶液に一度くぐらせ全体を温めないと乳化しなかったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's maintaining its state.
conversation.ja_sentence: この状態が保たれていますね。

conversation.en_sentence: My goodness, you finally did it!
conversation.ja_sentence: すごい、やりましたね！

conversation.en_sentence: This is a technological marvel.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは技術的驚異ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well done, Ken.
conversation.ja_sentence: よくやりました、健さん。

conversation.en_sentence: I am so proud of you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誇りに思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: It was really long and laborious.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に長く大変な作業でした。

conversation.en_sentence: We need to patent this.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは特許化しないと。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you done it before?
conversation.ja_sentence: 前にやったことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: No, never.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、一度も。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, this is going to be a great learning experience for you, so do it.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、これはいい勉強の機会になりますから、やりましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Where do I start?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこから始めればよいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'll email you our patent attorney's info.
conversation.ja_sentence: 特許弁護士の情報をメールしますね。

conversation.en_sentence: But before that, talk to Karen about searching for existing patents.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもその前に、カレンに先行特許検索について話してください。

conversation.en_sentence: You need to search thoroughly to make sure nobody has the same thing, or even something similar.
conversation.ja_sentence: 徹底的に調査して、同じもの、また似たものがないことを確認する必要があります。

conversation.en_sentence: Ask Karen about the criteria, she's done this many times.
conversation.ja_sentence: カレンに条件について聞いてみてください、彼女は何度もやっていますから。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, and how long is the filing process?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、申請プロセスはどのくらいかかりますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Well you need some studies for proof.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、証明するための研究が必要になります。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have the experiment log?
conversation.ja_sentence: 実験ログはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's really scribbled and all over the place.
conversation.ja_sentence: 書きなぐったものがあちこちに。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, maybe you want to run another one with a clean slate, might as well to be absolutely certain this works.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、これがうまくいくことをしっかり確かめるためにも、綺麗な状態のものを別に作りたいかも知れません。

conversation.en_sentence: How long will that take you?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらいで出来ますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I don’t know, about a month?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分からないですが、一ヶ月くらいでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Try to do it in 2 weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２週間でやってみてくれ。

conversation.en_sentence: We will file for all the applications as well so you have to start cracking on that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全ての応用に関して申請するつもりだから、どんどん進めてくれないと。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, there is a lot to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: わあ、たくさんやることがありますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hopefully we can get this filed by the end of next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出来るなら、来月末までにこれを申請したいからね。

conversation.en_sentence: My commute today was horrible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の通勤はひどかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh what happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かあったの？

conversation.en_sentence: The train that I usually take was cancelled without notice.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも乗る電車が予告なしにキャンセルになったんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That sucks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ひどいわね。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: How did you get to work then?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、どうやって来たの？

conversation.en_sentence: I had to take the bus.
conversation.ja_sentence: バスに乗らなくちゃいけなくて。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh you can get to work by bus?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、バスで来られるの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, but I have to transfer three times.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、でも３回乗り換えないといけません。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's not fun.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは大変だわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, the bus is always full by the time I get on.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、僕が乗る時間はいつも満員ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: And I can't sleep because I'm scared I'll miss my stop.
conversation.ja_sentence: 降り忘れたら困るから眠れないし。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have you thought of driving to work?
conversation.ja_sentence: 自動車通勤は考えたことある？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I know Ben drives to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンはやってるわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I thought about it but the parking is too expensive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 考えたことありますけど、駐車代が高すぎて。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: How much is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: いくらくらい？

conversation.en_sentence: It's around four hundred dollars a month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 月に100ドルくらい。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Wow that's expensive.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、それは高いわね。

conversation.en_sentence: Plus, you need to fill up on gas on a weekly basis.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、毎週ガソリン入れないといけないし。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think Ben has a parking pass issued by the company.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンは会社が発行している駐車券を持ってるはずよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh what, how come he gets one?
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、どうやって手に入れたんだろう？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Beats me.
conversation.ja_sentence: さあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can ask him!
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞いてみれば。

conversation.en_sentence: I will ask him now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今聞いてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベン、ちょっと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何？

conversation.en_sentence: Did the company issue you a parking pass?
conversation.ja_sentence: 駐車券、会社が発行したんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They issued one because I use my car for work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の車を仕事に使ってるから発行してくれたんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I get one too?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕ももらえるかな？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are you sure you want one?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にほしいの？

conversation.en_sentence: Why do you say that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Driving to work isn't as good as you think it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自動車通勤は君が思うほど良くないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There's a lot of bad drivers and pedestrians that jaywalk.
conversation.ja_sentence: タチの悪いドライバーや、ふらふら出てくる歩行者がいっぱいいるし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm actually thinking of returning the parking pass and just take the train to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、駐車券を返して、電車通勤にしようかと思っているところなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that right.
conversation.ja_sentence: へー、そうですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I would give it another thought.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、俺だったら考え直すな。

conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, yeah I'll think about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、そうですね、よく考えてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサム リーといいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Who?
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらさま？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社のサム リーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうでしたか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How are you doing?
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm good thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、元気です。

conversation.en_sentence: I just wanted to see if you got my email yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日のメールが届いているか知りたかったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, the one about rescheduling the meeting tomorrow, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、はい、明日のミーティングの日程変更の件ですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I did see it, but my computer has been giving me issues all morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見たんですが、午前中ずっとパソコンの調子が悪くて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry for not replying your email.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご返事できなくてすみませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: No not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: So I wanted to ask if we can reschedule the meeting tomorrow to next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでですね、明日のミーティングを来週に再調整できないかお伺いしたかったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm actually attending a conference in San Francisco next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、来週はサンフランシスコで会議に出席するんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But I'll be back on Thursday night, so I'll be free on Friday.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、木曜日の夜には戻りますんで、金曜日は空いてます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would Friday work with you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日でもいいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm available any time on Friday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日は何時でも大丈夫です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How does ten o'clock sound?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、10時でどうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you send me a new meeting invite?
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しいミーティング招待を送ってくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will send it to you after this call.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、このお電話の後にお送りします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for changing the meeting on such short notice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 急に変更いただきすみません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: No worries.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to the meeting next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、来週のミーティングを楽しみにしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Same here.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hope you have a nice day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良い1日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ワトソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Lisa, make sure to register for the Food Expo this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: リサ、今週必ずフードエキスポに登録してください。

conversation.en_sentence: They’re offering 30 percent off for registering 6 months in advance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 6ヶ月前に登録すると30パーセントの割引になるから。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing Eric.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解したわ、エリック。

conversation.en_sentence: I know your team has been anticipating the Food Expo all year.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたのチームは一年中フードエキスポを楽しみにしているわね。

conversation.en_sentence: What's so great about it anyway?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何がそんなに素晴らしいの？

conversation.en_sentence: What do you do there?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何をするの？

conversation.en_sentence: In a nutshell, it's a chance for vendors of food items to pitch to restaurants, hotels, and grocery stores.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一言で言えば、食品ベンダーがレストラン、ホテル、食料品店に売り込むチャンスなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: But, it's so much more than that Lisa.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもそれだけじゃないんだよ、リサ。

conversation.en_sentence: There are exhibit halls, expert-led workshops, culinary demonstrations, and so much food!
conversation.ja_sentence: 展示ホール、専門家主導のワークショップ、料理のデモンストレーション、そしてたくさんの食べ物があるんだ！

conversation.en_sentence: You get to sample everything for free!
conversation.ja_sentence: 全て無料で試食することができるんだ！

conversation.en_sentence: Then each night, they serve drinks, and it's a big party!
conversation.ja_sentence: それから毎晩、飲み物も振る舞われてお祭り騒ぎするんだ！

conversation.en_sentence: It sure sounds like fun.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは確かに楽しそうね。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you don't forget to work!
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事をするのを忘れないようにね！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh we work.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、働いているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We get a lot accomplished, and are able to build lasting relationships with prospective clients.
conversation.ja_sentence: 沢山のことを成し遂げて、見込み客との長い関係を築くことができるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: The first morning, everyone is tense because they've spent the last few days preparing their booths and setting up their products.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の朝は皆、数日間ブースの準備と製品のセットアップをしていたものだからピリピリしているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then after the first day, everyone walking around, people are ready to cut loose.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、初日の後はみんな歩き回って、羽目をはずす気になるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: This is when the real rapport building happens.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこから親密な関係を築くんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone has their guard down.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんな気を緩めているだろ。

conversation.en_sentence: It gives us a chance for genuine communication with prospective buyers.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは僕らにとって、将来の買い手との本物のコミュニケーションをするチャンスなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, last year I was able to close the deal with Fast Food Burger Chain A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際、昨年はファストフードバーガーチェーンAと契約することができたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Now they use our cheese exclusively on their cheeseburgers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、彼らはうちのチーズだけをチーズバーガーに使っているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's awesome Eric.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは素晴らしいわねエリック。

conversation.en_sentence: What are your goals for this year?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の目標は何？

conversation.en_sentence: We have decided to launch Product A this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は製品Aを発売することにしたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hopefully, this will create a lot of industry buzz.
conversation.ja_sentence: うまくいけば、業界の話題の多くを占めるだろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: We're having a hands on demonstration that is quite entertaining.
conversation.ja_sentence: ハンズオンの実演もやるんだけど、とても面白いんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: So many young employees are hired this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は若い人が沢山雇われたね。

conversation.en_sentence: Too many millennials if you ask me.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミレニアルが多すぎだと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How has it been having them work for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に働いてみてどんな感じかい？

conversation.en_sentence: It's definitely an adjustment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 順応しないといけないのは確かだね。

conversation.en_sentence: You know they are very different from our generation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我らの世代とは全く違うのは知ってるだろう？

conversation.en_sentence: It has been a learning experience for me as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にとっても学ぶ機会になってるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Obviously, the millennials have different work ethic.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明らかにミレニアルは違う勤労倫理を持っているよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I might sound a little judgmental here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は批判的かもしれないけど。

conversation.en_sentence: But they come off a little bit entitled and lazy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは少々甘やかされていて、怠けている感じがするね。

conversation.en_sentence: I see what you are saying.
conversation.ja_sentence: 言いたいことわかるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Our generation is willing to invest our time and effort in order to build our careers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我らの世代は、出世のために仕事に時間も労力も費やしてきただろう。

conversation.en_sentence: We were generally committed to our jobs and the companies we work for.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一般的に我々は自分自身の仕事、会社の為に献身的なんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yep, that's what I have been doing for the last 25 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、私は25年間ずっとそうやってきた。

conversation.en_sentence: But the millennials don't seem as committed as we are.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもミレニアルは我々ほど献身的ではなさそうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: They tend to leave for new opportunities after a few years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 数年経つと、新しい機会を見つけて去っていく傾向にあるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Their priorities are different too, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を優先させるかというのも違うよね？

conversation.en_sentence: It seems that they wanted something that benefit them in the long run.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは長い目で見て、自分に有利になる様な事を求めているようだ。

conversation.en_sentence: With the bad economy and the job insecurities the millennials have experienced, they don't expect things to stay the same.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミレニアルは不景気や職の不安定さを経験しているから、どんな事でも同じ状況が続くとは期待していないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Is that the reason they tend to switch jobs more frequently?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが頻繁に職を変えるのはそれが理由かい？

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe, but I could be mistaken.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多分ね、でも私の勘違いかもしれないけど。

conversation.en_sentence: The ones we hired this year seem pretty decent though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年うちに雇われた従業員は真面目そうだけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: I agree with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to accept the fact that they are totally different generation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが違う世代なんだという事を受け入れないといけないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: And I need to cut them some slack.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして少し大目に見てあげないと。

conversation.en_sentence: I have supervised Marissa and Caleb, and they work really hard.
conversation.ja_sentence: マリッサとケイラブの働きぶりを見たけど、彼らはとても真面目だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am just afraid they will leave us in a few years.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ数年後には彼らも我々の元を去ってしまうのか心配だけど。

conversation.en_sentence: That's my fear too.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは私も心配だね。

conversation.en_sentence: They are too good to let go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは失うには勿体ない人材だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's another thing to consider.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは、もう一つ考えなければいけない事だね。

conversation.en_sentence: We have to figure out ways to reduce turnover and increase employee retention.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうにかして従業員の離職率を低めて、定着率を上げる方法を見つけないといけないな。

conversation.en_sentence: Does that mean I have to be the coolest boss to make them like me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にいけてる上司になれという意味かい？

conversation.en_sentence: You don't have to, but it probably will help.
conversation.ja_sentence: ならなくてもいいけど、なるとプラスにはなるね。

conversation.en_sentence: But you just have to be you.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも君は君のままでいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You are a great role model for them already.
conversation.ja_sentence: もうすでに君は若い従業員にとって素晴らしい見本だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for saying that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有難う。

conversation.en_sentence: Now let me get back to being an awesome boss and help those young people.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ今からまた最高の上司になって若い子たちの手助けをしてくるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It was nice chatting with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 話せて良かったよ。

title: オフィス用品を注文する

conversation.ja_sentence: コピー用紙がもうすぐなくなりそうだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: We're almost running out of copy paper.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、気づいていませんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I didn't notice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今すぐ注文しておきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll order now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今週中に届くかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think they'll come this week?

conversation.ja_sentence: 週末までにたくさん印刷するものがあるんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I need to print out lots of things by weekend.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも注文した翌日に届くので、大丈夫でしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: They usually deliver the next day, so it should be fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、念のために、注文の際に確認しておきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: But I'll double check when I order, just in case.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしく頼む。
conversation.en_sentence: Appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: ついでに、大きめの封筒も少し頼んでくれるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also order large envelopes together?

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他には何かいりますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Anything else?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、それだけだ。

conversation.ja_sentence: お、容姿について話すのはやめとくか。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I guess I shouldn't talk about appearances.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、最近何かとうるさいから気をつけな！
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you should be careful as that's something the company is pretty stringent on.

conversation.ja_sentence: それにしても、うちの社食はなんで主食1品、副菜2品なんてめんどくさいルールになったわけ？
conversation.en_sentence: But still, how come our company cafeteria has an annoying rule of only 1 main dish and 2 side dishes?

conversation.ja_sentence: バッフェ形式だとケンみたいに食べすぎる人がいて、採算取れなくなったんじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: Because if we have a buffet, people like Ken will eat too much and maybe they aren't able to make a profit?

conversation.ja_sentence: 勘弁してよー、俺そんなに食べないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh please, I don't eat that much.

conversation.ja_sentence: みんな知ってるよ、皿に毎回大盛りなの。
conversation.en_sentence: We all know that you always put a lot on your plate.

conversation.ja_sentence: 腹が減っては仕事はできぬ！
conversation.en_sentence: You can't work if you're hungry!

conversation.ja_sentence: でた、戦国時代か。
conversation.en_sentence: There it is, you and your Sengoku period quotes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 隣のビルの事務所に転職しようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I should go work at the office in the building beside from us.

conversation.ja_sentence: 噂ですよね、隣のビルの食堂は美味しいって。
conversation.en_sentence: They say that the cafeteria is the building next to us is really good.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、職場の環境って大事だよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, the work environment is important.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に俺みたいな大食いには、食の環境ってとっても大事なわけよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Especially for a big eater like me, where the food environment is very important.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちら細身女子は、食べられる量が少ないから余計中身重視なのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Us slim girls can't eat a lot so we're more focused on the content.

conversation.ja_sentence: だから、うちの社食が毎日じゃ、いくらタダでも生き抜いていけないわけ。
conversation.en_sentence: So, if we eat at the company cafeteria everyday, we can't survive even if it's free.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺はタダより美味い飯はないと思う。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I think there is no better meal than a free meal.

conversation.ja_sentence: って事で、社食とってこよっと。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I will go grab some of the company meal.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はケンさんの嫌いなグリービーンズ盛り盛りのおかずですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: They have loads of green peas that you don't like as the side dish today.

conversation.ja_sentence: えー、俺も弁当買いに行かないとかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, maybe I have to go buy a bento too?

conversation.ja_sentence: ケン、昼休み終わっちゃうよー。
conversation.en_sentence: Ken, lunch break is almost over.

conversation.ja_sentence: よお、海瑠、今日はお疲れさん。
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, Kyle, good work today.

conversation.ja_sentence: あれ海棠部長、もう帰られたのかと思ってましたが。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, Kiichi, I thought you've left already.

conversation.ja_sentence: ワークショップの件でまだ何か？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you still have something you'd like to ask about the workshop?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや特に、お前と話がしたかっただけ。
conversation.en_sentence: Not really, I just wanted to talk to you.

conversation.ja_sentence: この後まだ仕事か？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you still working after this?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は確か...
conversation.en_sentence: I believe I have....

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、打ち合わせが金曜に延期になったんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: No, a meeting has been postponed until Friday.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はこれで終わりですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm done for the day now.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、一杯付き合えるな。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, you can join me for a drink, huh?

conversation.ja_sentence: 相変わらず強引ですね、部長。
conversation.en_sentence: You always push me too much, Kiichi.

conversation.ja_sentence: な、久しぶりだろ？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh well, it's been a long time, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、断る理由はないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I have no reason to say no.

conversation.ja_sentence: お前も飲むのは嫌いじゃないだろうに。
conversation.en_sentence: You rather like drinking, don't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 場所と相手によりますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It all depends on where and with whom I drink.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、俺はお眼鏡にかなったんだな？
conversation.en_sentence: So I passed your test, I guess?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、喜んでください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you should be proud.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は結構繊細で、人を選ぶタイプなので。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm quite sensitive and particular about people.

conversation.ja_sentence: はは、俺相手にそんだけの口がきければ上等だよ、海瑠。
conversation.en_sentence: Ha-ha, not bad if you can talk to me like that, Kyle!

conversation.ja_sentence: 入社の時からあなたみたいな疲れ知らずの上司に連れ回されましたからね。
conversation.en_sentence: I had been taken around by a tireless boss like you since I started working.

conversation.ja_sentence: 誰でもたくましくなります。
conversation.en_sentence: Anybody would be tough.

conversation.ja_sentence: お前みたいに反抗的だが真面目な新入り仕込むのは楽しかった。
conversation.en_sentence: I enjoyed training disobedient but earnest newbie like you.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、８年の長きに亘って。
conversation.en_sentence: You did, for eight long years.

conversation.ja_sentence: お陰様で、今ではどんなお偉方も平気ですよ、かなりクセのある方でも。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks to you, I can deal with any important people now, even pretty difficult ones.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、今のお前があるのは俺のお陰って事だな。
conversation.en_sentence: That means you owe what you are today to me, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 部長、あなたのそのプラス思考には敵いませんよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No one can think as positive as you do, Kiichi.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、お前に言いたい事がある。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I have something to say, Kyle.

conversation.ja_sentence: お前が経営企画に引っ張られた時、あそこがエリートコースだから営業抜けさせたんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: When you got promoted to the corporate planning, I let you leave the sales because you'd get into the fast lane there.

conversation.ja_sentence: ４年で異動希望、それもマーケに出すなら、手放すんじゃなかった。
conversation.en_sentence: If I knew that you were going to request a transfer in four years to marketing too, I wouldn't have let you go.

conversation.ja_sentence: あなたに育てていただいたので、今独り立ちできてるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: You've raised me so that I can stand on my own now.

conversation.ja_sentence: すぐCX企画部の評価を上げて見せますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll show you that I'm capable of building up a reputation for CX promotion soon.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、わかったよ、どんだけ巧くやるんだか見ててやるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, okay, I'll see how artfully you do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: はは、楽しんでいただけると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Ha Ha, I think you'll enjoy it.

conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえず、昔行ってた蕎麦屋でいいだろ？
conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, you don't mind the soba place we used to go, do you?

conversation.ja_sentence: この時期は美味い日本酒入れてるぞ。
conversation.en_sentence: They have fine sake this time of the year.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: オフィス戻って鞄取ってきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll go back to my office to get my bag.

conversation.ja_sentence: 海棠部長は、先に行っててくださって構いませんよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's okay if you go ahead, Kiichi.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解 。
conversation.en_sentence: All right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遅けりゃ、先にやってるぞー 。
conversation.en_sentence: If you take too long, I'd start by myself, alright?

conversation.ja_sentence: ご随意に。
conversation.en_sentence: As you please.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well I've printed out the resumes and cover letters we received.
conversation.ja_sentence: 届いた履歴書とカバーレター、印刷しておいたけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow that's a lot.
conversation.ja_sentence: わぁ、こんなに沢山。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There are over a hundred here.
conversation.ja_sentence: これで100以上はあるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How long was the posting up for?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらい掲載されてた？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It was up for around twenty days.
conversation.ja_sentence: 二十日くらい出てたな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So do you want to review them now?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、今、見たい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, let's do it.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、見ようか。

conversation.en_sentence: So what's the tip in screening job applications?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、求人の応募を審査するコツって何？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we don't have time to review every single one of them.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、一通ずつ全部見る時間がないからさ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I typically do a quick review of their cover letter.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は通常カバーレターをざっと見るよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If their cover letter is interesting then I will look at their resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: カバーレターが良かったら、その履歴書を見るね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If that seems okay then I'll put them in the shortlist pile.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしそれが良さそうだったら、候補者リストの山に入れる。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll give it a try.
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てみよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh this person is interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: わぁ、この人いいね。

conversation.en_sentence: He used to work at a shipping company as a logistics coordinator.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、輸送会社で物流コーディネーターとして働いてたって。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: His writing skills are a bit questionable though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の文章力はちょっと疑問だけどな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There's some odd looking sentences in his cover letter.
conversation.ja_sentence: カバーレターに変な文章があるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He's older than me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかも僕より年上だ。

conversation.en_sentence: That could make things awkward right?
conversation.ja_sentence: それって気まずくならない？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's up to you really.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはほんと、君次第だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I personally don't mind.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は個人的には気にしないけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean Elaine is a lot older than me.
conversation.ja_sentence: だって、イレーンは僕よりだいぶ年上だし。

conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいとこ突くね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll think about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 考えてみるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: A lot of it is about gut feeling.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大概は直感でしょ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once you actually meet the person, you can usually tell if this is the person you want to hire or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際その人に一回会ったら、大抵その人が採用したい人かそうじゃないかってわかるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't wait to meet them!
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らに会うのが待ちきれないよ！

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, they will have to get on your shortlist first though!
conversation.ja_sentence: まぁ、まず君の候補者リストに入らないといけないんだけどね！

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Ricky Lyon from K fabrics.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、Kファブリックのリッキー ライオンと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: May I please speak to Ayana Williamson?
conversation.ja_sentence: アヤナ ウィリアムソンさんはいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: This is she.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私ですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I am calling about the order you placed at our store earlier today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日店舗でオーダーされた品についてお電話させて頂いています。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I just got a word from our warehouse that the fabric you want is actually back-ordered.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様が希望されていた布がバックオーダーになっていると倉庫から連絡が入りました。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: What does back order mean?
conversation.ja_sentence: バックオーダーとはどういう意味ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Am I not getting it at all?
conversation.ja_sentence: 品物が手に入らないという事ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, back order means the item is temporarily out of order causing a delay on your order.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええっと、バックオーダーとは一時的に品切れになってしまい、オーダーが遅れてしまう事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: But the store associate I saw earlier placed an order for me.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、店舗の従業員はちゃんと私のオーダーを取ってくれましたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: The particular pattern you want is in high demand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 希望されていた品はとても需要が高いものでして。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: And obviously there was miscommunication between our store and the warehouse.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの店舗と倉庫の間できちんとコミュニケーションが取れてなかったようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I am sincerely sorry for the disappointment.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をお掛けしまして、本当に申し訳ございません。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, I was really looking forward to getting the fabric.
conversation.ja_sentence: あーあ、あの布が手に入るのをとても楽しみにしていたんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: None of the other stores had it in stock either.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他のお店もすべて品切れだったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Do you happen to know when it will be in stock?
conversation.ja_sentence: 在庫が入るのはいつかわかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: The warehouse manager believes it won't be another month or so.
conversation.ja_sentence: 倉庫のマネージャー曰く、あと一か月は入らないそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: Meanwhile, I am doing my best to source it from a different vendor for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: その間、私の方でも別の卸売業者から品を購入できないかと全力を尽くしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: But I do not have much luck.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもなかなか見つからないもので。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: As I mentioned already, most places have run out of them due to its popularity.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先ほど申し上げたように、人気商品の為ほとんどの店は品切れ状態のようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I can not wait another month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一か月も待てません。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any pattern that is very similar to the one I want?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が希望している品と似た感じのはありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I am actually opening up our sample book right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今手元で見本を開いているところです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: You wanted the paisley one with turquoise background, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ターコイズが背景のペイズリー柄のものですよね？

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the patterns are green, white, and navy blue.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、柄は緑、白、紺色です。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I have one that's almost identical.
conversation.ja_sentence: ほぼ同じの物が一つありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: The only difference is the background color.
conversation.ja_sentence: 違うのは背景の色のみです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: It's teal, but the colors of the patterns are exactly the same.
conversation.ja_sentence: ティール色ですが、柄の色は全く同じです。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I would like to go ahead and get it then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあそれをお願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, we don't have it in stock at our store right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念な事に、うちの店舗には在庫がありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: But it seems that the store in the town, Slidell, has some.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、スライデルにある店舗にはあるそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I can have it delivered here or you can go pick it up yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらへ配達して貰う事も、お客様の方で取りに行かれるのも可能です。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: Whichever works better for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご都合の良い方をどうぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アヤナ ウィリアムソン
conversation.en_sentence: I think I am going to drive up there to pick it up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で運転して取りに行きます。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I apologize again.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に申し訳ございませんでした。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー ライオン
conversation.en_sentence: I hope you will consider us again for your future shopping.
conversation.ja_sentence: またのお越しをお待ちしております。

conversation.en_sentence: Jack, you really did an amazing job last quarter.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジャック、前期は本当に良い仕事をしたわね。

conversation.en_sentence: You flatter me.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやあ照れます。

conversation.en_sentence: It was hectic, but we made it through.
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃ忙しかったですけど、なんとか終わらせました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes it was, but you did it, and you did it well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に大変だったわね、でもよくやったわ！

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for saying so.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: You brought up sales and made a huge profit for the company.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは我が社のために売り上げを増やして大きな利益を出したわね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, actually if it wouldn't have had the support from you and the entire department, I cold have never done it.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやあ、あなたや部の人たちのサポートがなかったらそうはいかなかったと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: You're too kind Jack.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人がよすぎるわね、ジャック

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I have some really good news.
conversation.ja_sentence: そういえば、良いニュースがあるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You aren't going to believe this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 信じられないと思うけど。

conversation.en_sentence: What?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What's going on?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: The board has decided to give you a bonus!
conversation.ja_sentence: 取締役会があなたにボーナスを出すことに決めたのよ！

conversation.en_sentence: What!?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's great Kim.
conversation.ja_sentence: わあ、嬉しいです、キム。

conversation.en_sentence: How much?
conversation.ja_sentence: いくらなんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: 3,000 dollars.
Oh my god, that's too much Kim.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわあ、多すぎますよ、キム。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: This is amazing.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく嬉しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, you've certainly earned it Jack!
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にあなたが頑張ったからよ、ジャック。

conversation.en_sentence: Say, it is Friday, I was thinking that all of us could go out and celebrate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は金曜日だし、みんなで出かけてお祝いしようかと思ってたんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, I'm picking up some bags for Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、Ａ社のバッグを取りに来ました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン ユーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I get your name please?
conversation.ja_sentence: お名前を伺えますか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's Sam Lee.
conversation.ja_sentence: サム リーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン ユーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I also get your order number?
conversation.ja_sentence: 注文番号も伺っていいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is 47238.

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン ユーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, yes we have the bags ready for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、バッグはご用意できております。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン ユーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll have Greg take care of the rest for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとはグレッグがご対応させていただきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, you must be Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、サムさんですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Greg.
conversation.ja_sentence: グレッグと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi there I'm Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、私はＡ社のサム リーと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: It's nice to put a face to the name.
conversation.ja_sentence: 名前は存じてましたが、お顔を拝見できてよかったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I have your bags ready for loading at the loading bay.
conversation.ja_sentence: バッグはすぐに積めるように搬入デッキに用意してあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Before we head out, can you just sign this invoice?
conversation.ja_sentence: 向かう前にこの請求書にサインをお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I can.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's head out now.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、では向かいましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So the bags are pretty heavy so I will use a small forklift to load it into your car.
conversation.ja_sentence: バッグはかなり重いのでそちらの車に積むのに小型フォークリフトを使いますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which car is yours?
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらの車ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's the black SUV over there.
conversation.ja_sentence: あそこの黒いSUVです。

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, can you open the trunk?
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、トランクを開けていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: グレッグ フアンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll bring the bags over with the forklift and directly load it in.
conversation.ja_sentence: フォークリフトでバッグを運んで、直接積みます。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam Lee from the Seattle office.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、シアトル事務所のサム リーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hello there.
conversation.ja_sentence: あら、こんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you can get me a risk assessment report.
conversation.ja_sentence: リスクアセスメントレポートを取り寄せてもらえないかと思って。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you send me the details of the company?
conversation.ja_sentence: その会社の詳細を送ってもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I can.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、送れます。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me what information I need to give you?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういった情報がそちらで必要か教えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: So in order to get the report, I'll need the company name, address, phone number, and website
conversation.ja_sentence: レポートを取り寄せるためには、会社名、住所、電話番号、そしてウェブサイトが必要です。

conversation.en_sentence: Will that be it?
conversation.ja_sentence: それだけですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that will be it.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、これで全部です。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will send that over right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、今送りますね。

conversation.en_sentence: How long will it take to get the report?
conversation.ja_sentence: レポートを取り寄せるのにどのくらいの時間がかかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think it will take a few days.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２、３日かかると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know once I get the report.
conversation.ja_sentence: レポートが届いたらご連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはよかった、どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to hearing from you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡をお待ちしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ニコール タムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではよろしくお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではまた。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Mr. Ken.
conversation.ja_sentence: おはよう、健さん。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Steve.
conversation.ja_sentence: おはよう、スティーブ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me take you to your work desk and then I will give you a tour of the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君をデスクに案内したあと、オフィスのツアーをしようか。

conversation.en_sentence: Here is your desk and work starts from 8am to 5pm every day, Steve.
conversation.ja_sentence: スティーブ、ここが君のデスクで、仕事は毎朝8時から5時までだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, very nice!
conversation.ja_sentence: わあ、とても素敵ですね！

conversation.en_sentence: Drop your belongings here, and let’s go!
conversation.ja_sentence: 荷物はここに置いて、行こうか。

conversation.en_sentence: OK, I am ready Mr. Ken.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、準備できました、健さん。

conversation.en_sentence: That is Suzy over there and is our senior financial analyst.
conversation.ja_sentence: あそこにいるのが上級金融アナリストのスージーだ。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be working with her in the future so let’s go say hi to her.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今後彼女と一緒に仕事するようになるから挨拶しにいこう。

conversation.en_sentence: Suzy, this is Steve, our department’s new addition.
conversation.ja_sentence: スージー、うちの部に新しく加わったスティーブだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Welcome on board, Steve.
conversation.ja_sentence: ようこそ、スティーブ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am very glad to see you!
conversation.ja_sentence: はじめまして！

conversation.en_sentence: I am very happy to be here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで働くことができてとても光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: Just let me know whenever you need me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助けが必要な時は知らせてね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am glad to be of any assistance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 喜んでアドバイスするから。

conversation.en_sentence: I am giving Steve a tour of the office so that he knows his way around.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何がどこにあるか分かるよう、スティーブにオフィスのツアーをしてるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, oh and please do teach him where the vending machines are located Ken.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、あ、健、自動販売機がどこにあるか教えてあげて。

conversation.en_sentence: See you later, Steve!
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあまた、スティーブ！

conversation.en_sentence: OK, Suzy.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、スージーさん。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the hallway is the Production area.
conversation.ja_sentence: 廊下の突き当りが製造エリアだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Seventy percent of our merchandise is produced right here in this facility and we also have one smaller manufacturing facility overseas that handles the rest of the production.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社の70パーセントの商品がこの施設で作られていて、それ以外は全て海外のもっと小さな製造施設で製造しているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be dealing with John, the Production manager.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は製造マネージャーのジョンとやりとりすることになるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I will introduce you to him later because he is in a meeting at the moment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今彼はミーティング中だから、後から紹介するよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, I need to remember that name.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、その方の名前覚えておきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Like I said during the interview, one of your daily jobs is to deal with the bank to keep track of our financial resources.
conversation.ja_sentence: 面接で言ったように、毎日の仕事の一環として、君には銀行とやりとりしてうちの資金の記録をとってもらいたいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Every morning, you will access our account through the Internet to get financial information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 毎朝インターネットで会社のアカウントにアクセスして、金融データを確認してほしい。

conversation.en_sentence: I should have a login and password, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ログインとパスワードが必要になりますよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will call our bank and inform them that you are our new employee.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、僕から銀行に電話して君が新しい従業員だと伝えておくよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Your next task is to call overseas to get other necessary information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次の仕事は海外に電話して必要な情報を得ることだ。

conversation.en_sentence: What kind of data do I need to get from our people overseas?
conversation.ja_sentence: 海外オフィスからどういった情報が必要なんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You will need financial data about their current and future projects.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの現在と未来のプロジェクトの金融データだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do they need any information from me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕が提供すべき情報はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you need to work with them on their budgets so you can fax or e-mail them the information and if you need to talk to them, call them as soon as you get in.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、君が彼らと一緒に予算を決めないといけないから、その情報をファックスかメールで送って、話をする必要がある場合は出社してすぐに電話しないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: Remember that they are eight hours ahead of us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 向こうは8時間進んでるから。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure that you create a file for each overseas project so you and I can review them at the end of every week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君と僕が毎週の終わりに見直しできるように、各海外プロジェクトに関するファイルを作ってくれるかな。

conversation.en_sentence: In the beginning, can you review the files with me more often?
conversation.ja_sentence: 初めのうちは、僕と一緒にもっと頻繁に見直してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I just want to make sure that I do my job correctly.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事を正しくやっているかを確認したいので。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, come see me whenever you have questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいとも、質問があればいつでもどうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't believe that you're leaving us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社辞めちゃうなんて、信じられない。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it will be very weird without you here.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、ここに君がいないと変な感じになるだろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: I didn't expect that this will happen so soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も、こんなに早くこうなるとは思ってなかったわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's your life.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、君の人生だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: You should go for it.
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみたらいいわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Why not?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Honestly, I don't think I could do what you are doing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 正直、僕だったら君のやることはできないと思うな。

conversation.en_sentence: You mean moving to a different country?
conversation.ja_sentence: 外国に引っ越すっていう意味？

conversation.en_sentence: Of course there's that.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんそれもそうだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean leaving this big company to pursue your real dream.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の本当の夢を追うためにこんな大企業を去るってこと。

conversation.en_sentence: I know, I had to argue a lot with my husband about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、私もこのことは夫とたくさん話し合わなければならなかったわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, did you try the special cocktail?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、スペシャル・カクテルはもう飲んだ？

conversation.en_sentence: I ordered it just for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたのために、特別に注文してあげたわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for organizing this party for me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のためにパーティーを計画してくれて、ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: You totally deserve this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君のためなら当然だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We love parties anyway.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうせみんな、パーティーは大好きだしね。

conversation.en_sentence: Especially when we can have it right where we work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 職場でできるときは、特にね。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me go and grab some cocktails for you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私みんなの分もカクテルもらってきてあげる。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you want something to eat, too?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か食べ物もほしい？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not that hungry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私そんなにおなか空いていない。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, trust me, you will need something otherwise you can't drink tonight.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、何かきっとほしくなるわよ、そうしないと今夜飲めないわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, just bring me anything you like.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった、じゃああなたが好きなのなんでもいいからお願い。

conversation.en_sentence: I will be right back!
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐ戻るね！

conversation.en_sentence: Are you excited about your new job?
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい仕事は、楽しみ？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: よく分かんない。

conversation.en_sentence: I think there will be some good points and bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいことも悪いこともありそうな気がして。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'm really happy for you though.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、でも本当、よかったじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: People think that we have everything just because we work here, but you know that's not true.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで働いているから何不自由ないと、周りには思われているけれど、実際はそうじゃないからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for saying that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう、そう言ってくれて。

conversation.en_sentence: Just don't forget to let us know how you're doing now and then.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、これからもときどき俺たちに近況報告するのは忘れないでね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank goodness we have internet, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 幸いインターネットがあるから、ね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's a small world with internet.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、インターネットがあれば、世界は狭いから。

conversation.en_sentence: You should come and visit me while I'm in India.
conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ遊びに来てね、私がインドにいるうちに。

conversation.en_sentence: I would love to visit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ行きたいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I join for that trip, too?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もその旅行、一緒に行っていい？

conversation.en_sentence: Here's your food and drinks.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、食べ物と飲み物よ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: This looks amazing.
conversation.ja_sentence: おいしそう。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello everyone, and good morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも皆さん、おはようございます。

conversation.en_sentence: As you all know by now, the company is in the red for this fiscal year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん既にご存知のように、本会計年度、弊社は赤字です。

conversation.en_sentence: Because of this, I have some bad news.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに伴って、皆さんに悪いお知らせがあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, we will be reducing our usual holiday bonuses for this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら今年の休暇中のボーナスが減額されることになりました。

conversation.en_sentence: The financial department has notified me that this is necessary, and it seems like there is nothing much we can do about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経理部よりボーナス減額が必要との知らせが入り、どうも私たちはどうすることもできないようです。

conversation.en_sentence: How much of a reduction are we talking about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらいの減額になるのでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be a 20% cut to this year's holiday bonuses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今年のボーナスは、20％の減額になります。

conversation.en_sentence: Also bonuses will be paid in two months.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに加えて、２ヶ月後にボーナスが支払われることになります。

conversation.en_sentence: But please be aware that there will be no layoffs.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、一時解雇は無いのでご留意ください。

conversation.en_sentence: That is good to hear, I guess.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Will there be any other spending cuts?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に何か支出削減はありますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, yes there will be.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、実はあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company will be suspending all business travel temporarily until further notice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社は追って通知があるまでは、すべての出張を一時中断します。

conversation.en_sentence: I see, when will this go into effect?
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、それはいつから有効になる事ですか。

conversation.en_sentence: This is effective immediately.
conversation.ja_sentence: 即時です。

conversation.en_sentence: So please cancel any travel plans you may have in the near future.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、もし出張予定が有りましたらキャンセルをお願い致します。

conversation.en_sentence: This is rather inconvenient.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはとても不利ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it certainly is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にそうですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, we had plans to visit Company B in Taiwan in February.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は私たちは二月に台湾のB社を訪れる予定があったのです。

conversation.en_sentence: They've been valuable business partners over the past year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは昨年からとても大事なビジネスパートナーでした。

conversation.en_sentence: It's unfortunate I will have to cancel this meeting with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らとのミーティングをキャンセルせざるをえないのは、とても残念です。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we hope these funding cuts will only be for a short term.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、この支出削減が短い期間だといいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I will notify you all as soon as I have any more information.
conversation.ja_sentence: また何か情報が入り次第、皆さんと共有致します。

conversation.en_sentence: Apologies to everyone for the inconvenience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんにご迷惑をおかけして大変申し訳ございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, hope to hear a good news from you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知いたしました、良いニュースが入るのを楽しみにしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello Mr. Kato, good evening.
conversation.ja_sentence: 加藤さん、こんばんは。

conversation.en_sentence: Good evening Mr. Araki.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんばんは、荒木さん。

conversation.en_sentence: As you know, we have meetings twice per year to review the performance of each employee.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知っているとは思うけど、年に二回各社員の評価をする為に面談をしているんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: We are planning to meet with all of the employees in your department over the next five days.
conversation.ja_sentence: この五日間で君の課内の全ての社員と面談をする予定なんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: There is no need to be nervous.
conversation.ja_sentence: 緊張する必要はないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Shall we get started?
conversation.ja_sentence: では始めようか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please continue.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.en_sentence: So how is your relationship with your coworkers lately?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近同僚との関係はどうだい？

conversation.en_sentence: I feel that I cooperate well with my coworkers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同僚とは協力し合えていると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I communicate with everybody in my office, and we regularly share ideas between each other.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はオフィスの皆とコミュニケーションを取ってよく意見を共有しあったりしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Are there any issues with coworkers you’d like to mention?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か言っておきたい同僚との問題はある？

conversation.en_sentence: No, none at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、特にないです。
