conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうだ、先週、息子さんのご結婚おめでとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I just wanted to double check our schedule tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: でね、明日の予定を再確認したかったんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will be flying in around 9 o'clock tomorrow, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日、９時頃着のフライトだったよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so I will pick you up, then drive to the site.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、じゃあ僕が迎えにいって、現場まで車で連れて行きますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: The drive will take around two hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 車で２時間くらいかかるから。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I think the site inspection will take another two hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに現場視察でさらに２時間程かかると思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Your flight is at 5 o'clock in the afternoon, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君の帰りのフライトは午後5時だよね？

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.en_sentence: We should have enough time, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 時間足りますよね？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そう思うけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's a domestic flight so you don't have to get to the airport so early.
conversation.ja_sentence: 国内線だからそんなに早く空港に行かなくてもいいし。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should be fine as long as you get there one hour earlier.
conversation.ja_sentence: １時間前に空港に着いていれば大丈夫でしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Think we are all set then?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、準備万端ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't forget to bring your inspection gear.
conversation.ja_sentence: 調査用具を忘れずにね。

conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: You'll need your helmet, vest, and steel-toed boots.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヘルメット、ベスト、安全長靴がいるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: It might rain so you should dress appropriately.
conversation.ja_sentence: 雨になるかもしれないから、雨具もいるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for the reminder!
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、リマインドどうも！

conversation.en_sentence: I'll see you tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日お会いしましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しみにしているよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス チャンバースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye for now.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、これで。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you need to buy anything for this fiscal year?
conversation.ja_sentence: この会計年度で何か買いたい物はある？

conversation.en_sentence: Like?
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like office supplies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 事務用品とか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like a mouse, charger cable, things like that.
conversation.ja_sentence: マウスや充電コードみたいな物。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We still have some leftover budget so if you need to buy anything then buy it now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経費がまだ残ってるから、買う物があるなら今買って。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、なるほど。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I get another monitor?
conversation.ja_sentence: モニターをもう一台買っていいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure why not.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん構わないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you really need it though?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも本当に必要なの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I do actually.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、実はそうなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I need it when I do research or enter data.
conversation.ja_sentence: リサーチやデータ入力のために必要なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be a lot more convenient if I have two screens so I can look at two things at the same time.
conversation.ja_sentence: スクリーンが２台あれば2つのものを同時に見られるので、今よりずっと便利になりますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, I'll have to keep alt tabbing.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃないとAltとTabを押し続けることになっちゃいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかったよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Monitors are pretty cheap these days.
conversation.ja_sentence: 近頃はモニターもだいぶ安いしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've seen a twenty-seven inch go for around a hundred dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: 27インチで100ドルぐらいのものも見かけたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you send me an email on which monitor you want?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのモニターが欲しいかEメールを送ってくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also include the administration department in the email?
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務部にも送っておいてね？

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello all, thank you for gathering today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、こんにちは、今日はお集まりくださいましてありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yichin do you mind if we all speak English today as Sylar is here?
conversation.ja_sentence: ユーチン、今日はサイラーがいるので、全員英語でもいいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Of course not, how are you Sylar?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん大丈夫です、サイラー、元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Yichin, good to hear your voice.
conversation.ja_sentence: やあ、ユーチン、声が聞けて良かったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How is Australia?
conversation.ja_sentence: オーストラリアはどう？

conversation.en_sentence: Sweltering actually.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はうだるような暑さですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Tokyo was much better, it sucks to be back here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京の方がまだましでした、ここに戻るのはうんざりです。

conversation.en_sentence: So I've got you 2 on the phone because I wanted to make sure we are on the same page regarding your fund's intentions with our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、当社に関するあなた方のファンドの考えについて、全員同じ認識だということを確認するため、今日はお2人にも電話で参加してもらいました。

conversation.en_sentence: Sylar has given me some feedback in confidence as to some concerns he has.
conversation.ja_sentence: サイラーからは、懸念があるとのフィードバックを内々でいただいています。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I got an email from Sylar regarding that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、その件に関しては、サイラーからEメールをもらっています。

conversation.en_sentence: I've taken his concern to Wang Feihong and he has been looking at past financials to see where you may be heading.
conversation.ja_sentence: サイラーの懸念はワン フェイホン社長に伝えてあり、フェイホンは御社の今後の方向性を考えるため過去の資金繰りを確認しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Just between you and me, and Syler of course, this doesn't look good.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここだけの話、もちろんサイラーもいますが、あまり良い状況ではありません。

conversation.en_sentence: Wang Feihong is mostly concerned at how, what's the word, um, careful, Keiko is.
conversation.ja_sentence: ワン フェイホンは、恵子さんが、なんと言いましょうか、えー、慎重であることを主に気にしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Yichin, it's fine, you don't have to sugar coat.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユーチン、いいんです、言葉を選ばなくてもいいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: She is way too stubborn and slow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さんは頑固で時間がかかりすぎると。

conversation.en_sentence: He was expecting some sort of change by now, but it seems to be the same, if not worse.
conversation.ja_sentence: フェイホンは、そろそろ何らかの変革があることを期待していたのですが、悪くはなっていないにしろ、変わってないようで。

conversation.en_sentence: Eugina, the board meeting was a disaster.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユジーナ、役員会議は最悪でしたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: She was shutting Alex off, and dancing around my questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さんはアレックスを制止して、私の質問もうやむやにしました。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't imagine Wang Feihong himself sitting at that meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: ワン フェイホンがあの会議に同席することなんて考えられません。

conversation.en_sentence: He will explode.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの人、爆発しますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you told me she didn't answer any of your questions..
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、あなたの質問には全く答えなかったと言ってましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's very disrespectful as we are one of your biggest investors.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社は御社の最大の投資元の一つなのに、非常に失礼です。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know what to say other than I deeply apologize for their behavior.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の経営陣のふるまいについては、深くお詫びを申し上げる以外に言葉もございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Is she okay though?
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さん、大丈夫ですかね？

conversation.en_sentence: Meaning?
conversation.ja_sentence: といいますと？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, is she, um, having some sort of, I don't know, breakdown?
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、あの方、その、よくわかりませんが、心身衰弱かなんかでしょうかね？

conversation.en_sentence: I don't understand how she can live in la-la land that long.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてあそこまで自分の世界に行っちゃってるのか、理解できないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: There seems to be something wrong and I'm worried for her wellbeing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かおかしいですよね、恵子さんの健康状態が心配ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's a new take.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは新たな見方ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I didn't think about that, but yeah, that is a possibility.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんなことは考えもつきませんでしたが、うん、それはありえるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know her personal affairs, or her medical history, so I can't really weigh in on that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 個人的なことや病歴などはわかりませんので、なんとも言えません。

conversation.en_sentence: But I do believe something needs to be done for the sustainability of our company and I am counting on C Fund for direction.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、当社の持続可能性のためには、策を講じる必要があることは確かで、当社の方向性はCファンドにかかっております。

conversation.en_sentence: So I'm still committed to working with you to turn things around for Company R, but just as a heads up, Wang Feihong himself will not be focusing on you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、私としてはまだ、R社の状況を好転させるためにご一緒に取り掛かることを約束しますが、警告として言います、ワン フェイホン自身の関心は御社から離れていくと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: He has allowed me to work with you, but there won't be any input from him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社と協力することは許可されていますが、今後フェイホンからのインプットはないでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for being straight with me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 率直に言ってくださりありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Eugina, I think this information should just be among us.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユジーナ、この情報はここだけにしないといけませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I actually think this is a good wakeup call for them.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、実のところ、これはうちの経営陣への警鐘だと思いますね。

conversation.en_sentence: If they know C Fund is losing interest, they may finally get their act together.
conversation.ja_sentence: Cファンドが関心を失っていることを当社の経営陣が知ったら、きちんと対処するでしょうから。

conversation.en_sentence: It's up to you what you tell management, but please remember I am still here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣へ何と言うかはあなたにお任せしますよ、でも、私がここにいることを忘れないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: It's better not to completely burn bridges.
conversation.ja_sentence: 背水の陣は敷かない方がいいでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for coming in.
conversation.ja_sentence: お越しいただきありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: This unprecedented weather is wreaking havoc on us, and there has been some overflow of pipes in the roof.
conversation.ja_sentence: この前例のない天気に大打撃を受けて、屋根の中でパイプが溢れています。

conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for the leaks you see around you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 周りに雨漏りが見られて、申し訳ありません。

conversation.en_sentence: I have heard on the news that 30 percent of Tokyo's buildings have burst pipes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京にある30％のビルでパイプの破裂があるとニュースで聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: The subway station had buckets everywhere too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 地下鉄の駅にも至るところにバケツがありましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, so, I would like to get back to the interview and introduce you to our team.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうですか、面接に戻り、チームにあなたのことを紹介したいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: This is Sylvester Ko, our CFO, and this is Karim Ahuja who leads the IT team.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらがシルベスター コー、当社の最高財務責任者です、そしてこちらがITチームを仕切っているカリム アフージャ。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be working closely with Karim.
conversation.ja_sentence: カリムと密接に仕事してもらう予定です。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, nice to meet you both.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、お二人とも初めまして。

conversation.en_sentence: So thank you for doing a video interview with me the other day, today is really to get a feel of what you will be doing here, and whether you will be interested.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、先日はビデオ面接をしていただきありがとうございます、今日は現にあなたがここで何をしていくのか、そして興味があるかどうかを実感していただく目的です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll let Karim do the talking.
conversation.ja_sentence: カリムに話を任せます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sergei.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、セルゲイ。

conversation.en_sentence: So Dr. Toshinaga forwarded me your CV and I believe you are exactly the person we need.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、利永さんからあなたの履歴書を転送してもらいましたが、まさに当社に必要な人材だと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically you will be doing what you have done at your previous company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的に前の会社でやっていたのと同じ事をしていただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be overseeing the sales office system and taking care of their issues.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業所のシステムの監督と問題への対処をしていただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be some backend work on our website when necessary, as well as taking care of our enterprise system.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基幹システムの管理と同様に、必要に応じて当社のウェブサイトのバックエンドの仕事も発生します。

conversation.en_sentence: The enterprise system is something we just installed, and the learning curve for our employees is quite steep.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基幹システムは導入したばかりのもので、学習過程は従業員にとってかなり険しいものです。

conversation.en_sentence: They are going to have a lot of questions, so I will guide you through the basics so you can deal with the tickets.
conversation.ja_sentence: たくさんの質問が出ると思うので、これらに対処できるよう基本をご案内します。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think I can handle that.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、できると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: We had a complicated enterprise system at my previous job but it only took me a few days to understand it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前の仕事でもややこしい基幹システムがありましたが、たった数日で理解できました。

conversation.en_sentence: What's that cracking sound?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何だこの割れるような音は？

conversation.en_sentence: I don't hear it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞こえないけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Something is definitely cracking.
conversation.ja_sentence: なにかが間違いなく割れている。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, Sergei watch out!
conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、セルゲイ危ない！

conversation.en_sentence: What just happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何が起きたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sergei, I'm so sorry, let me grab a towel.
conversation.ja_sentence: セルゲイ、申し訳ない、タオルを持ってきます。

conversation.en_sentence: This place is a mess!
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃだな。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been splashed as well!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も濡れちゃったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Did that ceiling panel just cave in with the weight of water?
conversation.ja_sentence: 水の重さで天井のパネルが崩れ落ちたの？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh dear, Sergei, you are all wet, are you ok?
conversation.ja_sentence: あらら、セルゲイ、ずぶ濡れですね、大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Obviously we can't continue with the interview, but I would like to extend an offer.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当然面接は続けられませんが、オファーを延長したいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Not just because of this, mind you, your CV is stellar and Karim is happy as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: この状況のせいだけではありませんが、いいですか、君の履歴書は一流だしカリムも喜んでいます。

conversation.en_sentence: My cashmere suit is wet!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のカシミアのスーツ濡れちゃったよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Here, Sergei, let me take that jacket so I can blow it with this dryer.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、セルゲイ、ドライヤーで乾かすのでジャケットを貸してください。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not wearing cashmere so I'm ok, thank you Karim.
conversation.ja_sentence: カシミアを着ているわけではないので大丈夫です、ありがとうございます、カリムさん。

conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for this mess, please send us your dry-cleaning bill.
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃなことになって申し訳ありませんでした、クリーニング代は請求してください。

conversation.en_sentence: I insist.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必ずですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've extended an offer, Karim.
conversation.ja_sentence: オファーを延長したよ、カリム。

conversation.en_sentence: That's great, Dr. Toshinaga.
conversation.ja_sentence: さすが、利永さん。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, thank you but let me go home and think it over.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの、ありがとうございます、でも一度家に帰って考えさせてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、こんにちは。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I am glad to see we have a big audience today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はたくさんの方がいらっしゃって嬉しいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I'm sure you guys are eager to hear more about what I have to say today.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日私がお話しすることに皆さん大変興味をお持ちだと思うのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: But before I start, I'd like to thank Government Agency A and Company A for co-organizing today's event.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、始める前に、まず政府機関AとA社さんに、今日のイベントを共同開催してくれたことを感謝したいと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I'd like to thank Mike Mostow for his work in helping the deal materialize.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、この協定の実現のためにご協力くださったマイク モストウさんの仕事ぶりにもお礼を言わせてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Mostow, would like to say something to the audience?
conversation.ja_sentence: モストウさん、観客の皆さんに何か一言ありますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thank you Chris.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ありがとう、クリス。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: As you may all know, the trade deal was signed earlier this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんご存知かと思いますが、今年に入って貿易協定が締結されました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Although there were some issues along the way, all the government officials involved have made sure things went smoothly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その過程において問題はいくつかありましたが、係わった政府関係者たち全員が確実に物事がスムーズにいくようにしました。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: We appreciate your hard work Mr. Mostow.
conversation.ja_sentence: モストウさん、大変なお仕事、ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I'm happy to be here today to have Chris and his team present to you the new trade deal.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、今日ここにいて、クリスと彼のチームが新貿易協定について発表出来るのを喜ばしく思っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク モストウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Chris, I will hand the floor back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: クリス、どうぞお話してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much Mr. Mostow.
conversation.ja_sentence: モストウさん、大変ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, let's get right into it then.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、早速始めましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: The CPTPP is a new trade agreement between eleven countries.
conversation.ja_sentence: CPTPPは11か国間の貿易協定です。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of the eleven, seven countries have already officially joined while the remaining four are still in the discussion phase.
conversation.ja_sentence: その11のうち、7か国が正式に参加していますが、一方残りの4か国はまだ検討中の状態にあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: The seven countries that have signed on are, Mexico, Japan, Canada, Singapore, New Zealand, Australia, and Vietnam.
conversation.ja_sentence: 署名した7か国は、メキシコ、日本、カナダ、シンガポール、ニュージーランド、オーストラリア、ベトナムです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: The four remaining are, Brunei, Chile, Malaysia, and Peru.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残りの4か国は、ブルネイ、チリ、マレーシア、ペルーとなっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So the biggest feature of this trade deal will be the reduction or removal of tariffs on a large number of goods.
conversation.ja_sentence: この貿易協定の目玉となるのは、多数の製品にかかる関税の引き下げもしくは撤廃です。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: For Canada, one of the biggest benefit is the reduction of tariffs for meat products in to the Asian market.
conversation.ja_sentence: カナダにとって、大きな利点の一つは、アジア市場への肉製品にかかる関税の引き下げです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: One of Canada's key market will be Japan and we expect the trade of meat products to increase greatly.
conversation.ja_sentence: カナダの主要市場の一つが日本なので、肉製品の貿易が大幅に増えることを予測しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Key products will be beef and pork.
conversation.ja_sentence: 主要製品は牛肉と豚肉になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Now aside from the tariffs, the deal also brings other benefits among the countries.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、関税だけでなく、協定は国々の間にその他の利益ももたらします。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: For example, this will open up opportunities for other companies in other countries to bid for government contracts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、これによって他の国の他の企業が、政府との契約に入札する機会を持つことができます。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Typically, government contracts can only be bid by the local companies but this will change that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 典型的に、政府の契約には、地元の企業だけが入札できるのですが、これによって変わるでしょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: And with the reduction or removal of tariffs, it will allow foreign companies to be more competitive in bidding for government contracts abroad.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、関税引き下げもしくは撤廃によって、外国企業が海外での政府契約入札においてより競争力をもつことが出来るようになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So the trade deal is not a simple reduction or removal of tariffs but has other features to promote the prosperity of the countries involved.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、貿易協定は、単なる関税の引き下げや撤廃だけでなく、関係国の発展を促す他の機能も持つのです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I could go on for hours but since we still have a whole day ahead of us, I will stop around here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何時間でも話すことができますが、まだまだこの先丸々一日ありますので、この辺で止めておきますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So after this, we will have a panel session with the trade commissioners from Government Agency A.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、この後は、政府機関Aの貿易委員の方々とのパネルセッションになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: They will provide their insight on the benefits of the trade deal, and explain some of the government programs that companies could use.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは貿易協定の利点に関する見通しを教えてくれ、企業が利用することのできるいくつかの政府プログラムについて説明してくれます。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: These would be things that exporters could potentially use to expand to a new market.
conversation.ja_sentence: これらは、輸出業者が新しい市場へ進出するのに利用できる可能性のあるものだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: The panel session will be held in the room behind me so please head on over after this.
conversation.ja_sentence: パネルセッションは、私の後ろにある部屋で開かれますので、この後、どうぞそちらに向かってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you and I hope everyone learns a lot from today's event.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました、そして、皆さんが今日のイベントで多くを学ばれることを願っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben, do you know where this shipment will be going to?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえベン、この船便がどこに行くか知ってる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's the one to Shanghai.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは上海に行くやつだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are you asking about the Company?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社について聞いてるのかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah and their address.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、あと住所と。

conversation.en_sentence: Freight Forwarder A is asking for the BL instruction and they need to know the name of the consignee by the end of the day.
conversation.ja_sentence: A運輸がBL指示が必要だって言ってて、今日中にコンサイニーの名前が知りたいそうなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Elaine usually does this but she took the day off today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 普段はエレインがやってるけど、今日は休みを取ってる。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It should be the same as the last shipment to Shanghai.
conversation.ja_sentence: この前の上海宛の便と同じはずだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it should be Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからB社だね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But don't quote me on it.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも確実なことは言えないな。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, why don't you check the phytosanitary application that Elaine sent out yesterday?
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、エレインが昨日送ってた植物検疫申請書を確認してみたら？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That should have the information you're looking for.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が探してる情報が載ってるはずだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I didn't see that email.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、そのメールは見なかったな。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know when she sent the email?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女がいつそのメール出したか知ってる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It should have been yesterday morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日の朝のはずだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認させて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, she sent it out around 11 o'clock yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、昨日の11時頃に送ってるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, but she didn't Cc you in the email.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、でも君をccに入れてなかったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, no wonder.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、だから。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you forward that email to me?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのメール、僕に転送してくれる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll do that now.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、今やるね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: やった、ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send her a note to always include you in these kind of emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: こういうメールには必ず君も入れるように言っておくよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、よろしく。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise I won't be able to cover for her when she's away!
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃないと彼女がいない時にカバーできないからね！

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, Han, please come and check our intern's work.
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、ハン、ちょっと来て、インターンの仕事をチェックしてくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: He's unbelievable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 信じられないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, yes I am checking it right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、はい、今チェックしますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Did he spend all night messing up all these files?
conversation.ja_sentence: あいつ、ひと晩かけて、ファイルを全部めちゃくちゃにしてくれたのか？

conversation.en_sentence: It seems that way.
conversation.ja_sentence: みたいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: At least he's persistent.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少なくとも、粘り強いな。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe that's it though.
conversation.ja_sentence: だが、たぶん、それだけだろうな。

conversation.en_sentence: Why didn't you tell him what the problem is?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何が問題か、なんで彼に言わなかったんだ？

conversation.en_sentence: Why should I do that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして僕が言わないといけないんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: He won't survive here anyway.
conversation.ja_sentence: どっちみち、彼はここではやっていけませんよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you're right.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そうだな。

conversation.en_sentence: Is he preparing for his presentation now?
conversation.ja_sentence: あいつ、今プレゼンの準備してるのかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Who's going to be his partner?
conversation.ja_sentence: パートナーは誰がやるんですかね？

conversation.en_sentence: Who knows.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知るか。

conversation.en_sentence: By the way, who hired him?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、誰があいつを雇ったんだ？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any clue about that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かヒントはある？

conversation.en_sentence: I have no idea who hired him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰が雇ったかまったくわかりませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: I have a briefing with the senior manager now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、シニアマネジャーとミーティングがあるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.en_sentence: I will see you later.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、あとで。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning sir.
conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I made...
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、やっておきましたのは…

conversation.en_sentence: We saw it already.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう、見たよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You surely proved it quantity-wise.
conversation.ja_sentence: 量をこなせるのは良くわかった。

conversation.en_sentence: But, that's it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だが、それだけだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, you!
conversation.ja_sentence: おい、君。

conversation.en_sentence: Why did you ignore the folder trees that Mr. Han had made?
conversation.ja_sentence: ハンさんが作ったフォルダーの階層をどうして無視したんだ？

conversation.en_sentence: I didn't ignore them, but there were so many files that didn't fit there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 無視はしませんでしたけど、入りきらないファイルがたくさんありました。

conversation.en_sentence: That's the company standard.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれは会社の基準なんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what that means?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういう意味かわかるか？

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone understood and agreed on it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆それを理解して了承してるってことだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry sir, I will keep that in my mind.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、覚えておきます。

conversation.en_sentence: You don't have to be sorry, just try to remember that for next time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 謝らなくてもいいけど、次回のために覚えておくように。

conversation.en_sentence: We all work together.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆一緒に仕事してるんだからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Scott, have you got a minute?
conversation.ja_sentence: スコット、ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, what's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ、どうしました？

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you could do me a favor.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとお願いがあるんだけど、いいかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: That depends what it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 内容によります。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, John has asked me to design and write a brochure to promote the new service.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが、新サービス宣伝用のパンフをデザインして文面を作るようにジョンに頼まれたんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to let him down, but with the sales reports due for next week and the trade show to prepare for, it's a bit much for me to take on at the moment.
conversation.ja_sentence: がっかりさせたくはないんだけど、私も来週提出の売上報告書があるし、準備しなくちゃいけない展示会もあるし、今それを引き受ける暇ないのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: If you have the time, I was hoping you might be able to whip something up?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし、時間があったら、何か手早くできる案がないかなと思って。

conversation.en_sentence: If I remember correctly, weren't you the one who spearheaded that project?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の思い違いでなければ、そのプロジェクトを指揮ってませんでしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Surely someone so instrumental in its development would do a better job?
conversation.ja_sentence: だったら、その過程で役に立った人の方がいい仕事をするんじゃないでしょうかね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but graphic design is not my forte.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだけど、グラフィックデザインは得意じゃないのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Plus, I now need to put all my effort into things like the trade show, to help get my baby released to consumers.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、今は、大事に育ててきた製品をお客さんにお披露目する展示会に全力を注がないといけないの。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: はーい、わかりましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It shouldn't be a problem, and I do enjoy that kind of work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だと思います、そういう仕事は好きだし。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I remember what a great job you did on the design work for the M contract.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうよ、M社との契約のときにすごく良いデザインしたの覚えてる。

conversation.en_sentence: I know it will be done well if I leave it in your hands.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたに任せておけば、素晴らしく仕上がると思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, well don't forget I'm also covering for Mark while he's off with the flu.
conversation.ja_sentence: はあ、ですが、今、僕、インフルで休んでいるマークの仕事もやっていることを忘れないでくださいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: If anything comes through from one of his clients, that will have to take priority.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし、マークの取引先から何か来たら、そちらの仕事を優先しますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろん。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll see if I can make a start after lunch today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日、昼食後から始めらるか確認してみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks Scott, I really appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうスコット、すごく助かる。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll be on hand if you have any questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問があったらいつでも聞いて。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll be out of the office for a bit with the preparations, so you might have to reach me by email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 準備でちょっと外出するから、メールで連絡してもらうことになるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: No worries.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: So, I just wanted to touch base with everyone, and see what stage everyone is at.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、皆に集まってもらって、進捗状況を聞きたかったのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Simone, how's it going sourcing a manufacturer?
conversation.ja_sentence: シモーヌ、メーカー探しはうまくいってるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Pretty good, I have some promising leads in China.
conversation.ja_sentence: 順調です、中国に強力な見込み会社がいます。

conversation.en_sentence: One factory I spoke to is pretty confident they can create the shapes we require with their CNC machines, based on the designs I sent them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡をとった工場は、送ったデザインをもとにCNC装置で必要な型を作れることがかなり確実なようです。

conversation.en_sentence: They know the designs are a very early work in progress though, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そこの会社、デザインがかなり初期段階のものだと知ってるんだよね？

conversation.en_sentence: The final design is likely to be quite different.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最終的なデザインはかなり違ったものになりそうだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I made them aware of that, and they suggested we also design a custom jig when we know what the final design will look like.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そのことは伝えてありますし、最終的なデザインがどのような感じになりそうかわかったときに特注治具をデザインすればいいのではと提案していました。

conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, that's a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: ふむふむ、いい案だな。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it would help them get the production started right away.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、そうすれば、向こうもすぐに生産に入れますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Now, Asa, what's been going on in your team?
conversation.ja_sentence: アサ、君のチームはどうなってる？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, at the beginning of last week, we fell behind schedule.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、先週初めの段階で、予定より遅れていたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: This is something I've already discussed with my team, and we came up with some better practices, and were back on track by Friday.
conversation.ja_sentence: チームのメンバーとは既に話し合って、より良いやり方を決めましたので、金曜日には遅れを取り戻しました。

conversation.en_sentence: That's great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Then, on Tuesday, we invited some members of the public to come and trial the different materials and color combinations, and we explained the various features.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、火曜日に一般客を招いて、いろいろな素材や色の組み合わせを試してもらい、いろいろな特徴も説明しました。

conversation.en_sentence: We gained some really valuable feedback, which we have shared with the design team.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく貴重なフィードバックももらえたので、デザインチームとも共有しておきました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Ian couldn't make it today, but he wanted to reiterate how grateful he was for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、イアンは今日は参加できなかったんだが、その件に関しては繰り返し感謝してたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He said the feedback gave him and his team confidence that they are moving in the right direction, and has informed them what they need to focus on next.
conversation.ja_sentence: フィードバックを聞いて、彼もチームも正しい方向に向かっていると確信できたと言ってたし、次に取り掛かるべきことについて指示したそうだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Lastly, Vanessa, do you have anything to share?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最後に、バネッサ、何か共有することはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, as you all know, we had a great brainstorming session for the product name, and came up with some options that we thought reflected our brand and the concept really well.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、皆さんご存知のとおり、商品名についてすごく良いブレーンストーミングのセッションができまして、当社のブランドとコンセプトをとてもよく反映している候補名がいくつか上がりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, the legal team has since got back to us and rejected our number one candidate, as there is already a product with that name.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、残念なことに、一押しだった候補については、既に同じ商品名があるということで、その後法務部から連絡を受けて却下されました。

conversation.en_sentence: Another favorite could apparently be deemed offensive in Spanish, so it looks like it's back to the drawing board.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、もう一つの有力候補はスペイン語では下品とみなされるようで、振り出しに戻ってしまいました。

conversation.en_sentence: Not to worry, it's still early days.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心配するな、まだ時間はある。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, let's wrap it up there.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、この辺で切り上げるとするかな。

conversation.en_sentence: We'll reconvene in 2 weeks to share what progress we've made.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２週間後にまた集まって、進捗を報告してもらいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you hear back from Company A yet?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社からもう返事は来た？

conversation.en_sentence: No, not yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、まだなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I sent them an email last week.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールは先週送りました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm planning to follow up with them on Friday this week if I don't hear back.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし返事がなかったら今週金曜日にフォローアップする予定なんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't you try calling them?
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方に電話してみるのは？

conversation.en_sentence: Actually the person in charge is out of the country this week so I was hoping he'd reply my email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は担当者さんが今週は国外にいるので、メールに返信もらえるのを期待してたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: He's in Europe right now and it's a bit hard to reach him by phone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は今ヨーロッパに居て、電話で連絡するのはちょっと難しいんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean, I wouldn't want someone calling me when I'm on a business trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: というか、自分が出張の時に誰から電話かかってきてほしくないんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Especially when I'm sleeping or something.
conversation.ja_sentence: 特に寝てるときとか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, fair enough.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、それはそうだな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to follow up on this though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもこの件、フォローアップをするの忘れないように。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our team in Tokyo has been waiting for a reply and we should at least let them know what is up by the end of this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京でうちのチームが返事を待ってるから、少なくとも今週末までにどうなっているか連絡したほうがいい。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll update the team in Tokyo on Friday regardless.
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらにしても金曜日に東京のチームに報告します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

title: Scheduling a meeting with a colleague

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Laura, can we talk for a bit now?
conversation.ja_sentence: やあローラ、今ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, sure!
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、いいよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh by the way, how was your holiday?
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、そういえば、お休みどうだった？

conversation.en_sentence: Did you enjoy Lisbon?
conversation.ja_sentence: リスボン楽しめた？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh it was brilliant!
conversation.ja_sentence: すっごく良かった！

conversation.en_sentence: The weather was perfect, food was great, people were all so nice!
conversation.ja_sentence: 天気は最高、ご飯も美味しいしみんな優しくて！

conversation.en_sentence: Paul got himself addicted to the egg tarts and he was eating at least 3 everyday throughout the stay.
conversation.ja_sentence: ポールはエッグタルトにハマって滞在中毎日最低3個は食べてた。

conversation.en_sentence: Haha!
conversation.ja_sentence: あはは！

conversation.en_sentence: He's now relentlessly googling the recipe so that he can recreate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近は家でも作ろうとしてレシピをひたすらググってるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's nice!
conversation.ja_sentence: いいね！

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure he cooks some for me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の分も作ってくれるように言っといて。

conversation.en_sentence: Definitely!
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん！

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, so, I wanted to set a meeting with Company T next week and I was wondering when you would be available to attend.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、えっと、来週にT社とのミーティングをしたくて、君がいつ空いてるか知りたかったんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically they can do any day so it's up to us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方はいつでも大丈夫みたいだから、僕たちの都合で決めていい。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, I will be able to go out, give me a sec, let me check my schedule.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうだよね、外に出れる日が、ちょっと待ってね、予定確認する。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I can do Wednesday and Thursday.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、水曜日と木曜日は外出できる。

conversation.en_sentence: Also Friday but only after 2 p.m.
conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日も午後2時以降なら。

conversation.en_sentence: I will have a meeting all morning and a lunch appointment with my trainee right after that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 午前中はずっと会議で、その後すぐ指導担当の後輩とランチの約束があるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、ありがとう！

conversation.en_sentence: I can do Wednesday too so that's great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も水曜日空いてるからちょうどいいや。

conversation.en_sentence: I will email them then set the time and let you know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方にメールで伝えて、時間が決まったらまた言うね。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。

conversation.en_sentence: I will send us the list of documents we need by then to remind us.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングまでに必要な書類のリストをリマインドのために自分たち宛に送っておくね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう！
すみません、新しい文房具がほしいんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I would like to get some stationery.

conversation.ja_sentence: どんな種類の文房具？
conversation.en_sentence: What kind of stationery?

conversation.ja_sentence: 赤い水性サインペンが欲しいんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I want a red non-permanent marker.

conversation.ja_sentence: 備品棚に在庫なかった？
conversation.en_sentence: Didn't you see it on the supply shelf?

conversation.ja_sentence: 探してみたんだけど見つからなくって。
conversation.en_sentence: I looked for it but didn't find it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 倉庫に在庫があるかもしれない。
conversation.en_sentence: We might have some in the storage.

conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに必要？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you need it soon?

conversation.ja_sentence: できれば早めに欲しいな。
conversation.en_sentence: The sooner the better.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、今見てくるけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I will go see it now.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Please do.

conversation.ja_sentence: それと、ついでにもう一ついい？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you one more favor?

conversation.ja_sentence: 何？
conversation.en_sentence: What is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: こっちは急ぎじゃないんだけど、ハサミも新しいのが欲しい。
conversation.en_sentence: This is no rush, but I would like a new pair of scissors.

conversation.ja_sentence: ハサミも備品棚になくて。
conversation.en_sentence: There weren't any scissors on the supply shelf either.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しいハサミは備品棚に置いてないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We don't keep new scissors on the supply shelf.

conversation.ja_sentence: 備品棚においてあるのは基本的に消耗品だから。
conversation.en_sentence: We only keep consumable goods on the supply shelf.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ、どうすればいい？
conversation.en_sentence: I see, what should I do?

conversation.ja_sentence: サインペンと一緒に倉庫の在庫を見てみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will see if there are some along with markers.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしあったら、すぐに渡せるけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I will get a pair for you right away if there are any.

conversation.ja_sentence: なかったら業者に今日発注するから、明後日届くと思う。
conversation.en_sentence: If not, I will place an order from the supply company and should receive them tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です。
conversation.en_sentence: I gotcha.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうだ、備品棚の持ち出し表、全部の欄が埋まってたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, another thing, the take-out chart was completely filled.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい用紙を出しておいた方がいいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You should probably get a new one out.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう、早速やっておくよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I will get to it right away.

title: 会社エントランスのインテリアについて

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社のエントランスって殺風景ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't the entrance to our company a little drab?

conversation.ja_sentence: 掃除はしているけど、シンプル過ぎるっていうか。
conversation.en_sentence: It gets cleaned regularly but it is too plain.

conversation.ja_sentence: まぁ、華やかな感じじゃないよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's definitely not vibrant.

conversation.ja_sentence: エントランス入ったら、社名があって応接セットと内線電話だけですからね。
conversation.en_sentence: When you come into the entrance, all you see is the company name, the reception furniture, and the telephone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一応、観葉植物もあるけどね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, a plant is there too.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、この観葉植物も会社が移転した時に取引先からお祝いで頂いたものですし。
conversation.en_sentence: But we got this plant as a gift from our client when our office moved.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと枯れてきちゃっている部分もありますよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Some of the leaves are dying though.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんは、結構色んな会社訪問してるじゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Takada-san, you have visited many companies, haven't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 印象に残っている会社のエントランスとかあります？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you remember any company that has an impressive entrance?

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社の規模によって全然違うから、一概にうちの参考にはならないけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Since it varies greatly depending on the size of a company, it might not be very useful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今までで一番インパクトがあったのは、J証券かな。
conversation.en_sentence: The most impressive one by far is J brokerage.

conversation.ja_sentence: 外資系の大手投資銀行だから、全く参考にはならないんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It is a large international brokerage firm, so it's not helpful to compare though.

conversation.ja_sentence: どんな感じなんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How was it?

conversation.ja_sentence: ワンフロアすべて受付。
conversation.en_sentence: The whole floor is dedicated to the reception area.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかも、東京駅隣接のビルの１８階で一面ガラス張りだから見張らしのいいこと、いいこと。
conversation.en_sentence: In addition, it's 18th floor of a building that is right next to Tokyo Station with glass windows, which offers a breathtaking view.

conversation.ja_sentence: 受付のカウンターに女性が２人座っていて、受付が終わるとホテルのロビーの用なソファーに案内されて。
conversation.en_sentence: There are two female receptionists sitting at the front desk, and once you sign in, you will be guided to the sofa in an area that reminds you of a hotel lobby.

conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスフロアに案内されるまで、優雅に待つという。
conversation.en_sentence: You can wait elegantly until you get guided to the office floor.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高級ホテル並みのホスピタリティ。
conversation.en_sentence: As hospitable as a luxury hotel.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは凄すぎますね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds awesome.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、もうちょっと身の丈にあったレベルで、よかったと思った会社はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you think of any company that is more like our level then?

conversation.ja_sentence: 外資系ヘッジファンドのH投資顧問かな。
conversation.en_sentence: Foreign hedge fund managing company H might be it.

conversation.ja_sentence: どんな感じでした？
conversation.en_sentence: How was it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 日比谷のホテルに隣接しているオフィス棟に入っているんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It's in a building adjacent to a hotel in Hibiya.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなにエントランスが広いわけではなく、ちょうどうちの会社くらい。
conversation.en_sentence: The entrance isn't that big, it's probably the same size as ours.

conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく品があったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It is very classy.

conversation.ja_sentence: ドアを開けると、社名のロゴが掛かっていて、ガラスのテーブルに内線電話があったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: When you open the door, you see the company logo hung up and a telephone placed on a glass table.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちと一緒じゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds pretty similar to ours.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、大きな花瓶にいつも生花のアレンジがあって、いい香りがするんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: And there was a fresh flower arrangement in a large vase, and it smelled wonderful.

conversation.ja_sentence: きつい香りじゃなくて、ほんのりフローラル。
conversation.en_sentence: It wasn't overpowering, just enough floral scent.

conversation.ja_sentence: 嗅覚をくすぐるの、有効ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Olfactory stimulation can be useful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 生花のアレンジメントを飾るくらいだったら、うちも真似できるじゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can we borrow their idea and add a fresh flower arrangement?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、ちょっと片付けて試験的にやってみる？
conversation.en_sentence: Then should we straighten up and do it as a trial?

conversation.ja_sentence: 周りの反応を見てみようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see how people react to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね、やってみましょうよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good, let's do it.

title: 取引先の新社屋移転御祝について

conversation.ja_sentence: 野田さん、ちょっとご相談なんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Noda-san, can I ask you something?

conversation.ja_sentence: はいはい、何でしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, what is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 来月１５日に、A証券さんが本社移転するんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: My client, A Securities, is moving their headquarters on the fifteenth of next month.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御祝を贈りたいんだけど、どうすればいい？
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to send them a gift.

conversation.ja_sentence: 品物と予算は決まっているんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what you want to send and how much you want to spend?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、逆にいつも何を贈っているのかなと思って。
conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering what you always send out as gifts..

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、オフィス移転の場合は観葉植物が多いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: For a move, how about a decorative indoor plant?

conversation.ja_sentence: グリーンレンタルの業者を利用している会社も多いですけど、喜ばれますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There are many firms who rent potted plants for their offices, but most still seem very happy to receive something like that as a gift.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に、会議室や応接室が沢山あるオフィスだとインテリアとして重宝されますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Especially if they have many conference and meeting rooms, they are perfect as decorations.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、観葉植物だと長期間置いてもらえますからね。
conversation.en_sentence: They also last for a long time.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、贈り主の名前が入った立て札を付けたままにしてあると、当社の名前がその会社に訪れた方の目につきますしね。
conversation.en_sentence: We can also add a plaque with our company name with the gift which will show their visiting clients our relationship.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 種類でいうと、パキラやユッカ、ベンジャミンなんかが多いですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: We usually choose pachira, yucca and ficus benjamina...

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算は１万５千円から２万円くらいでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Our budget is usually somewhere between 15,000 and 20,000 yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: 種類を言われても想像できないけど、うちのエントランスにあるような植物って感じ？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm not familiar with those plants but are they like the ones in our entrance lobby?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、無難な感じです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, something pretty ordinary.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、予算は１万５千円で、種類は任せるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You can choose which kind and let's spend 15,000 yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと大きい鉢植えを１つ贈っておいてくれる？
conversation.en_sentence: Let's also choose a big planter for it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: OK, I will do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 立て札に記入する名前はどうしましょう？
conversation.en_sentence: What name should I ask to put on the plaque?

conversation.ja_sentence: 社長名でよろしく。
conversation.en_sentence: Please put the president's name.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、早速手配しておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it, I will make arrangements immediately.

title: スーパー惣菜担当の新人研修

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日からこちらでお世話になる小泉です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Koizumi, pleased to meet you, I am starting today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人研修担当の武藤です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Muto, in charge of new recruits, pleased to meet you as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: ではまず小泉さん、調理場に入る前にこの帽子を被ってください。
conversation.en_sentence: Koizumi san, please wear this hat before entering the kitchen.

conversation.ja_sentence: 髪の毛がはみ出ないように帽子に全部髪の毛を入れてくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Please make sure that no hair is showing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 髪のピン留めは付けてて大丈夫ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it OK to put hair clips in?

conversation.ja_sentence: 帽子の中に入っていれば問題ありませんよ。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as it's inside the hat.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次に石鹸で3分間しっかり手を洗ってからアルコールを手に吹き付けてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Next please properly wash your hands with soap for 3 minutes before disinfecting with alcohol.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんなに徹底した衛生管理を行うんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You take such care of hygiene!

conversation.ja_sentence: 食中毒を防ぐためにはなにより衛生管理の徹底が基本ですからね。
conversation.en_sentence: We basically need perfect hygiene to avoid food poisoning.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあまずはお弁当のご飯から盛っていきましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let start packing rice for the bento boxes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 炊飯器から200グラム、この計りで量ってこの容器にいれてもらえますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Will you scoop 200 grams of rice, weigh it on this scale, and put it into the container?

conversation.ja_sentence: 200グラムぴったりって難しいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's hard to be exactly 200 grams.

conversation.ja_sentence: 215グラム以内だったら誤差は気にしなくて大丈夫ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as it's within 215 grams, don't worry about the difference.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただし少ないのは厳禁です。
conversation.en_sentence: But make sure it is not less.

conversation.ja_sentence: たまにお客さんで家でご飯の量を量って足りないとクレーム出す人がいるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, some customers weigh the amount of rice and complain that there isn't enough.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、気をつけます。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand and will be careful.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご飯が盛れたらこの湯煎されたレトルトの具をご飯の上に載せてください。
conversation.en_sentence: After the rice, put this heated the boil-in-the-bag ingredient onto the rice.

conversation.ja_sentence: これは何のどんぶりを作っているんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What dish are we making?

conversation.ja_sentence: 中華丼ですね、うちのスーパーの人気商品です。
conversation.en_sentence: A Chinese donburi which is one of the most popular product at our supermarket.

conversation.ja_sentence: 載せました、これで良いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Here it is, is this good?

conversation.ja_sentence: これだと真ん中に具が固まっているのでご飯の上に均等に載るようにしてください。
conversation.en_sentence: The topping is all in the middle, make sure it's spread evenly over the rice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後に右端に漬物を乗せたら蓋を閉じます。
conversation.en_sentence: Please place the pickles on the right side and then put a lid on it.

conversation.ja_sentence: これで完成でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is this done?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、商品シールを貼ります。
conversation.en_sentence: No, we still need to put the product sticker on.

conversation.ja_sentence: この中華弁当500円って書いたシールでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it this "Chinese bento box 500 yen" sticker?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、これは中華弁当ではなくて中華丼です。
conversation.en_sentence: No, this is a "Chinese bowl" not a "Chinese bento box".

conversation.ja_sentence: シールの貼り間違いが最近多く起きているので品名と値段はしっかり確認してください。
conversation.en_sentence: People have been applying the stickers inconsistently recently so please make sure that you're matching the stickers and food correctly.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、シールは容器のどのあたりに貼るって決まってるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I will be careful, is there a particular position for the stickers?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Perhaps you'll have to take a break from work if your child has the flu.

conversation.en_sentence: I might have to if that's the case.

conversation.en_sentence: But I haven't heard any outbreak of the flu at the nursery, so I think it might be fine.

conversation.en_sentence: If ever my child does have the flu, then I'll have to take the day off tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: あさっての金曜日は、主人がお休みなので、相談して出勤できるようにします。
conversation.en_sentence: My husband has the day off the day after tomorrow on Friday, so I'll make sure to show up to work by then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書の出力がありますし。

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしてもらえると助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be a big help then if you could show up on Friday.

conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、迎えに行って、そのまま小児科に行ってきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll go pick my child up then and proceed to the pediatrician.

conversation.ja_sentence: 診察が終わったら、明日行けるようでもお休みになるようでも、電話を入れるようにします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll make sure to give a call whether I can come to work or not tomorrow once we have finished with the check-up.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何でもなく、一晩寝たらケロッと元気になっているといいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope your child gets better after a night's rest.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に、そう願います。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope so too.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、すみません、失礼します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll be on my way then.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お疲れ様でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.

conversation.ja_sentence: お子さん、お大事にしてください。
conversation.en_sentence: I wish the best for your child.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: 業務中の事務員の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: ねぇ、ちょっといい？
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, do you have time?

conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたの？
conversation.en_sentence: What's up?

conversation.ja_sentence: 気になってる事があるんだけど・・
conversation.en_sentence: I've got something on my mind.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何が？
conversation.en_sentence: Such as?

conversation.ja_sentence: 最近、上田さんの出す領収書の数がとても増えてきているのよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I noticed that Mr. Ueda gives me so many receipts recently.

conversation.ja_sentence: それが全部、商談のための諸費用としてのなの。
conversation.en_sentence: He says they are for the company meetings.

conversation.ja_sentence: 上田さん、そんなに忙しくしてたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Has he been so busy these days?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私が見る限り、そうだとは思わなかったんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't think he was so busy as far as I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: 週末は、必ず商談のためと言って、レストランの領収書持ってくるのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: He gives me a restaurant receipt every weekend regularly, saying it's for a company meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週末なんて、あの三ツ星ホテルの中のフレンチのお店だったの。
conversation.en_sentence: It was a French restaurant in a three-star-hotel last weekend.

conversation.ja_sentence: えー、なんて贅沢！
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's luxury.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに加え、六本木のクラブの領収書までよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, he gave me a receipt of a nightclub in Roppongi.

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ！
conversation.en_sentence: Gosh!

conversation.ja_sentence: こんな事が1ヶ月くらい続いてて、ちょっと怪しいなって思ってるんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It's been a month, so I've started to feel suspicious.

conversation.ja_sentence: どう思う？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you think?

conversation.ja_sentence: 聞く限りでは、ちょっと怪しいかも。
conversation.en_sentence: It sounds a bit dodgy from your story.

conversation.ja_sentence: でしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたらいいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: What shall I do?

conversation.ja_sentence: うーんと・・
conversation.en_sentence: Let me see …

conversation.ja_sentence: 上田さんの取引先はどこだったかしら？
conversation.en_sentence: Who is Mr. Ueda's client?

conversation.ja_sentence: U商社よ。
conversation.en_sentence: Trading company U.

conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、U商社との商談は２週間前にまとまったって聞いてるけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Eh, I've heard we had closed the deal with company U two weeks ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだったの？
conversation.en_sentence: Is that so?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、確認の書類探してくるね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll find a paper to confirm.

conversation.ja_sentence: それを持って行って、上田さんに詳細を確認したらどう？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't you take the paper and talk to Mr. Ueda to check the details?

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、ちょっと心細いな。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm not sure if I can do it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 上田さんは、支店長に気に入られているからといって、私たちには、横暴なところがあるから。
conversation.en_sentence: He is bit a domineering to us as he is a branch manager's favourite.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにね。
conversation.en_sentence: True.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私も、何度も嫌な思いしてるわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I've been offended by him many times.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、山本主任に相談して見たら？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, how about speaking to Ms. Yamamoto for help?

conversation.ja_sentence: それいい考え！
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, good idea!

conversation.ja_sentence: 山本さんは、上田さんより勤務歴が長いしね。
conversation.en_sentence: She's been working here longer than Mr. Ueda.

conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の言うことなら、上田さんも素直に聞くかもしれないね。
conversation.en_sentence: He might be listening to her obediently.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうよ、もしその領収書が私用で使われたものだとしたら、とんでもないことだもの。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it'll be so wrong if the receipts were for private use.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速、山本さんに相談してくるね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll have a word with Ms.Yamamoto now.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、頑張ってね。
conversation.en_sentence: Good luck.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、慈善活動について話し合いたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Today we'd like to discuss our charity activities.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご存知の通り、当社では年に一度発展途上国に行き、慈善活動をしていますね。
conversation.en_sentence: As you know, we go to a developing country every year for charity work.

conversation.ja_sentence: それ以外に、何ができると思いますか？
conversation.en_sentence: In addition to that, what else can we do?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、国外限定でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is that limited to overseas activities?

conversation.ja_sentence: それとも、国内でもいいのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Or can we do something here?

conversation.ja_sentence: どちらでもいいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Either will do.

conversation.ja_sentence: 意見を聞かせてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Any ideas?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は、国内でのことですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I have something for domestic activities.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社でフードドネーションを募るというのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about making a food donation as a company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 普段は仕事で忙しいので、どこかに行くというのは難しいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: As we are all busy working, it's not easy to be away.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社に大きな箱を設けて、使わない缶詰や、保存食を持って来て入れてもらう。
conversation.en_sentence: So we could put a large box and ask the employees to bring in some unwanted tinned or preserved food.

conversation.ja_sentence: これなら負担なくできるのでは？

conversation.ja_sentence: それはいい考えだと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a good idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 以前、子供の学校でその様なフードドネーションウィークがありました。
conversation.en_sentence: My kid's school had a food donation week before.

conversation.ja_sentence: かなりの数が集まったと聞きしたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I heard they collected loads of donation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 集まった食べ物はその後どうするのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Where do we donate the collected food?

conversation.en_sentence: We could bring them in to a local church.

conversation.ja_sentence: または、フードバンクをしているボランティア団体に持って行くのもいいのでは？
conversation.en_sentence: Or, we could send them to a volunteer group offering a food bank.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに、わが町にもたくさんの路上生活者や、生活困窮者がいますもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, we can see lots of homeless or people on benefits in our area.

conversation.ja_sentence: 身近な人を助けるというのは、とても大事なことですよね。

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、うちに使っていないたくさんの缶詰があるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I have many unopened tinned food at home.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちもですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: So do I.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもの時用に買っていて、全然使っていませんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: I stocked up some for the emergency, but forgot to use them up.

conversation.ja_sentence: きっと社内でも、その様な人がたくさんいるでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe more people in our office are similar.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh!

conversation.ja_sentence: もう着れなくなった衣類も持って来てもらったらどうでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: How about asking everybody to bring along the old clothes as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に、子供服は助かると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Particularly, children's clothing is in demand.

conversation.ja_sentence: 賛成！
conversation.en_sentence: Agree!

conversation.ja_sentence: 子供服は、すぐサイズが着れなくなってしまうし。
conversation.en_sentence: Kids quickly grow out of the clothes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 喜んでもらえることは、間違いないと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I'm sure kids' clothes will be well accepted.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, then we'll do.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、社内でドネーションを募るという事に決まりですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So, we've agreed to ask donation of food and clothing internally.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速、社内メールを作って、みんなに配布します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll work on an e-mail message and send it out to the employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: 二週間後の、月曜日から始めるというのはどうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は、ドネーションを入れる箱を用意しますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll find a box for the donation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: たくさん集まるといいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope we will have a lot of donation.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
