title: 新入社員歓迎会について

conversation.ja_sentence: 緑川さんお疲れ様！
conversation.en_sentence: Midorikawa-san, how are you!

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日営業部は新入社員歓迎会なんでしょ、たくさん楽しんでおいでね。
conversation.en_sentence: So tomorrow is the sales department's new employee welcoming party, go have lots of fun.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私楽しみな反面ちょっと憂鬱なんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to it but I'm also a bit depressed.

conversation.ja_sentence: なんでどうしたの、何か心配事でもあるの？
conversation.en_sentence: What's wrong, are you worried about something?

conversation.ja_sentence: なんか学生時代のサークルの飲み会とは違うんで粗相をしたらどうしようって。
conversation.en_sentence: It will be different from a drinking party from a club in my university days so I'm worried I will get out of line.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなこと心配してたの？
conversation.en_sentence: You were worried about something like that?

conversation.ja_sentence: 歓迎への感謝の気持ちを表して普通にいつもどおり楽しく過ごせばいいと思うわよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think you can just express your gratitude to the party and just enjoy it normally as usual.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつもどおりってそんなことだけでいいんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Normally as usual, that's all?

conversation.ja_sentence: 歓迎会ってみんなで仲良くするものでしょ、それにお互い知り合うものでもある。
conversation.en_sentence: You're supposed to have fun with everyone at welcoming parties, it's also to learn more about each other.

conversation.ja_sentence: あんまりよそよそしかったりギクシャクしててもおかしな印象を持たれるだけよ。
conversation.en_sentence: They will have a weird impression of you if you are too uptight and awkward about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなものなんですねー、普通が1番ってことですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So just like that, being normal is the best, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: なにか飲み会で新入社員がやらないといけないことってありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything that a new employee must do at drinking parties?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうねー、気遣いができればいいんじゃないかしら？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it would be good if you are attentive.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば取り皿が足りない人はいないかとか、お酒がまだ来てない人がいないかとか。
conversation.en_sentence: Like making sure everyone has an extra plate or making sure everyone has got their alcohol.

conversation.ja_sentence: グラスのお酒が減ってきたら足してあげるとか。
conversation.en_sentence: Pouring some alcohol in their glass if it's getting less.

conversation.ja_sentence: あれってどれぐらいになったら注げばいいんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: When should I be pouring it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 3分の1とかですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Like one third?

conversation.ja_sentence: それとも完全にグラスが空になってからですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Or when the glass is completely empty?

conversation.ja_sentence: これ人によって好みがいろいろなのよね、私は空になってから派だけど。
conversation.en_sentence: People preferences varies but I'm the type that does it when it is empty.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特にどれぐらいっていうのはないのよね。
conversation.en_sentence: There isn't really a set amount.

conversation.ja_sentence: 1回3分の1ぐらいになった時に注いでみればわかるんじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: You will probably know if you try pouring it once when it is around one third.

conversation.ja_sentence: 嫌な人なら断るだろうし、そうじゃない人はそのままグラスを差し出すわよ。
conversation.en_sentence: People who dislike it will say no and those who are fine will just hand you their glass.

conversation.ja_sentence: でもそこまで細かくグラスに目を光らせなくても気づいた時に注げばいいわよ。
conversation.en_sentence: But I don't think you have to be that detailed and attentive, just pour it when you notice it.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱり部長とか課長の席には率先してお酒を注ぎに行ったほうがいいんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Should I be pouring alcohol to managers or the section chief?

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ1回くらいは行ったほうがいいわね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it would be good to go at least once.

conversation.ja_sentence: 偉い人から順番に回るんですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: So I should go around in order in terms of rank?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、基本は序列順ね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, by rank in general.

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日の会場はどこなの？
conversation.en_sentence: Where is the venue tomorrow?

conversation.ja_sentence: S駅の側のHホテルの宴会場って聞いてます。
conversation.en_sentence: I heard it is at the banquet hall of Hotel H beside Station S.

conversation.ja_sentence: だったら丸テーブルで6名ずつぐらいで座ると思うわ。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I think there will be around 6 people sitting around a round table.

conversation.ja_sentence: 課長と同じ席になったらそこは序列気にせず課長のを先に注げばいいわ。
conversation.en_sentence: If the section chief is sitting with you then you can ignore the rank and just pour it for the section chief first.

conversation.ja_sentence: それとあそこだとフレンチのコースだから周りのペースに合わせて食べてね。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, they serve a French course menu so make sure to eat at a pace that others are eating at.

conversation.ja_sentence: 妙に遅かったり早かったりするとマイペースだなって捉えられかねないから。
conversation.en_sentence: If you are oddly slow or fast, they may think you are the type that does things at your own pace.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、私男兄弟の中で育って食べるのが早いんですけど気をつけます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I grew up with older and younger brothers so I eat fast but I will be careful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後にくれぐれもこれだけは覚えておいて。
conversation.en_sentence: Finally, be sure to remember this by all means.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員歓迎会だけではなくて今後会社の飲み会では酔っ払いすぎないこと。
conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to not get too drunk not just for new employee welcome party but for future company drinking parties.

conversation.ja_sentence: 酔っ払いすぎると自分が気づかないうちに変わってしまう人もいるから。
conversation.en_sentence: There are people who completely change without realizing when they get too drunk.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、アドバイスありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, thank you for your advice.

conversation.ja_sentence: でもあそこの伊勢海老のクリームソースは最高よ、楽しんできてね！
conversation.en_sentence: But their lobster cream sauce is awesome, have fun!

conversation.ja_sentence: これはこれは谷中先生、いつもお世話になってます。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello Yanaka san, it's a pleasure, as always.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社長、こちらこそいつもお世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello Miyajima san, the pleasure is all mine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は健康診断についてちょっとお話ししたかったものでお伺いしました。
conversation.en_sentence: Today, I wanted to discuss the health examination situation with you.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、社員に健康診断を受けさせないといけないんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, we need to provide medical examinations for our employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ、これは労働安全衛生法で義務付けられているんです。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right, it is mandated by the Labor Safety and Health Act.

conversation.ja_sentence: 長時間労働での健康障害が増えてるので、かなり厳しくなっていますね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's very strict now that there's been an increase in health disorders due to long working hours.

conversation.ja_sentence: よしわかった、やろう。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, then we must get this in order.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社指定の病院で受けさせればいいんだっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Do we send them to one of the company approved hospitals?

conversation.ja_sentence: それもひとつの方法としてありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: That is one option.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは、会社で集団健診を実施か従業員各自に受診させてその結果を提出させるかです。
conversation.en_sentence: Or the company can organize a group health examination, or allow each employee to take an exam and submit results.

conversation.ja_sentence: いろいろあるんだね、うちはどれがいいんだろうか？
conversation.en_sentence: I see, there are many options, which would you recommend?

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社であれば、加入してあるG県健保組合の指定医療機関での受診が望ましいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I recommend using one of the G prefectural health insurance association approved medical institutions for your company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一番手間がかからずにできる方法です。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be the easiest option.

conversation.ja_sentence: それって健保組合の指定した医療機関じゃないとダメなのかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Would it have to be a medical institution approved by the health insurance association?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、原則そうなります。
conversation.en_sentence: As a general rule, yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実はうちのクライアントにL病院があってね。
conversation.en_sentence: We have an L hospital as our client.

conversation.ja_sentence: できたらそこで受けさせたらいいんじゃないかと思ったわけよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I was hoping we can use the hospital, if possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今リストを持っていますので調べてみます。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see, I will check the list right now.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、L病院ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, L hospital is...

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながらリストには入っていないようですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately is not on the list.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、ここで受けさせるにはどうしたらいいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Hum, how can we use this hospital?

conversation.ja_sentence: この健康診断は会社が全ての費用を負担しないといけません。
conversation.en_sentence: The company would have to cover the costs for the health examinations.

conversation.ja_sentence: なので私がL病院に事前に話をして社員さんから費用徴取をしないように伝えます。
conversation.en_sentence: I can contact L hospital and tell them not to charge the fees from the employees ahead of time.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ各自に受診させるので健康診断の必要項目以外を受診希望することもあります。
conversation.en_sentence: There might be incidences where they might request something other than what's required when the exams are done individually.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えばどういうケース？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you give me an example?

conversation.ja_sentence: バリウムではなく胃カメラ検査を希望したりするケースですね。
conversation.en_sentence: For example, in a case when an employee chooses a gastroscopy procedure, rather than taking barium.

conversation.ja_sentence: この差額でプラス2万円になったりすることもあります。
conversation.en_sentence: The cost difference will be an additional 20,000 yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: その場合はオプションになることを事前に社員さんに伝えておく必要があります。
conversation.en_sentence: We would need to inform the employees in advance that there are different options.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の方で、健康診断のお知らせのようなものを作りましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I will draw up a memo for the health exam.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしく、頼んだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 受ける時期は皆一緒じゃないといけないのかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Would we need to get all of them to take the exam around the same time?

conversation.ja_sentence: なかなか現場の都合もあって、皆一緒には難しいと思うんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it will be difficult for all of them to go around the same time due to site constraints.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは構いませんよ、皆さんで揃えなくても問題ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: I  agree and  they won't need to do it at the same time.

conversation.ja_sentence: それとこれは法律上、受診時間中の賃金支払い義務はありません。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, it is not required by law to pay employees during the examination.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただし、労働時間として取り扱い、賃金を支払うことが望ましいとされています。
conversation.en_sentence: But it is recommended that the company treat that time as work, and provide pay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社員からすれば、会社からの命令で健康診断に行くという形になりますので。
conversation.en_sentence: Most employees consider it as a company requirement that they do the exam.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、勤務時間扱いにしよう。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand, we will treat it as working hours.

conversation.ja_sentence: では私は健康診断のお知らせができましたらまたご連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: OK, I will let you know when I prepare the memo for the health exam.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご苦労さん、よろしく頼むよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great, thank you.

title: 新人の疑問に答える文芸雑誌編集者

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人だからってどうして電話を率先して取らなくちゃいけないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Just because we're new, why do we have to take the initiative in picking up calls?

conversation.ja_sentence: 手が空いている人が取ればいいだけじゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Why can't whoever is available pick it up?

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも率先して電話を出る事によって先様に新しい人が入ったんだなと名前を覚えてもらえます。
conversation.en_sentence: But if you take the initiative and pick up, it will be a chance for the other party to know that a new person joined and to remember your name.

conversation.ja_sentence: そして電話対応が良いとあなたの評価が回りまわって社外からも社内からも上がります。
conversation.en_sentence: And if the way you handled the call was good, your reputation will get better from outside and inside the company.

conversation.ja_sentence: おお、それはいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that'd be nice.

conversation.ja_sentence: ということで、電話対応お願いしますね。
conversation.en_sentence: So, please do pick up the calls.

conversation.ja_sentence: ではどうして僕たちが資料集めや必要な情報の選定をしなくてはいけないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Then why is it that we have to gather reference materials and pick out information?

conversation.ja_sentence: これは作家先生本人がするべきことですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't this something that the author should do?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、アマチュアの作家さんはもちろんプロの作家先生でも自分でされる方はおられます。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, there are amateur authors and of course professional authors who do it themselves.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも私は作家先生に今目の前にある物語に集中してほしい。
conversation.en_sentence: But I want the author to focus on the story in front of them now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 資料集めは地味に時間がかかるものです。
conversation.en_sentence: Gathering reference materials does take some time to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: だからその時間を執筆に使ってほしいと、私は思っています。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I'd rather have the author spend that time writing.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに違う目線で資料を集め選定することは、作家先生の想像力を刺激する事にも繋がります。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, gathering materials and picking out the information from a different perspective can bring about a new idea for the author too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ資料を集めるだけじゃないんです。
conversation.en_sentence: So it's not just simply gathering materials.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういった事も編集者の仕事だと、私は考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: I believe that things like that are part of an editor's job.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、そういう意味もあるんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, there is such a meaning behind that too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、佐々木さん。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much Sasaki-san.

title: 自社製品のテレビ取材

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 木檜さん、おはようございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Satoru!

conversation.ja_sentence: おお、ピーターソンさん、朝から随分元気だね。
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, Ron, you're pretty hyper today.

conversation.ja_sentence: なんかあったの？
conversation.en_sentence: What's up?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 今度ウチの生体認証センサーがテレビに出るって知ってる？
conversation.en_sentence: Have you heard that our biometric sensor will be on TV soon?

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、なんかそんな事誰かが言ってたっけ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, I've heard someone was saying something about that, I guess.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 木曜夜にやってるT放送のニュース番組に出るんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll be on the news show for T Station every Thursday night.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: あの番組の中で「今週の最先端技術」って紹介するコーナーあるじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: You know "State of the Art Technology of the Week" section in that show, don't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それ私も結構見てますよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I watch that quite often, too!

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そういえばこの間、AI使ったサイバー攻撃防御システムとかってF株式会社が取り上げられてたな。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, yeah, F Corporation was on that show the other day, showing their cyber security system that uses AI or something.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、あの時出てたFの人、話が上手かったわ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right, that person from F was pretty good at talking.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はあのコーナーって、一発撮りなんだって。
conversation.en_sentence: I've heard that section is actually shot in one go.

conversation.ja_sentence: えー、でも結構突っ込んだ質問とかしてくるよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, but they often ask some sharp questions, don't they?

conversation.ja_sentence: この研究所って、機密保持契約のプロジェクト多いから何言うか気を付けないとだね。
conversation.en_sentence: This laboratory has quite a few of projects with non-disclosure agreement, so we have to be careful what we say, huh?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: ウチのラボからは誰が出るの？
conversation.en_sentence: Who's going to be on the show from our lab?

conversation.ja_sentence: 多分長澤さんじゃないかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I guess Kaname would be the one.

conversation.ja_sentence: 彼、開発部長だし。
conversation.en_sentence: He's our Chief of the Development, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: あのセンサーの事一番良く知ってるでしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: And he knows everything about our sensor.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼なら安心してテレビの前に座ってられるね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I can relax in front of the TV if he'll be on air.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、噂をすれば...。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, speaking of the devil...

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 長澤さん、おはようございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Kaname!

conversation.ja_sentence: おはよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: みんな朝から集まって何の話？
conversation.en_sentence: What are you all chatting about gathering together?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は仲間はずれなのかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Am I missing on something here guys?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ長澤さん、ウチのセンサーがテレビで紹介されるって話をしてたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we were just talking about our sensor being introduced on TV, Kaname.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あれか、みんな耳が早いね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that, you guys have sharp ears, huh?

conversation.ja_sentence: 長澤さん、それっていつ放送されるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: When is it going to be on air, Kaname?

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、３週間くらい先のオンエアだったかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it'll be on about three weeks from now.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: もう撮ったんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Have they shot already?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、来週火曜日の午後のはずだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Not yet, it's supposed to be next Tuesday afternoon.

conversation.ja_sentence: テレビ局の撮影班がここに来るよ。
conversation.en_sentence: A camera crew is coming here from the TV station.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、何処で撮るんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, where are they shooting?

conversation.ja_sentence: 第一会議室だと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I believe they'll shoot it in Meeting Room 1.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先方がなるべく広くて明るい部屋がいい、って言ってたからね。
conversation.en_sentence: They said they'd prefer a spacious room with lots of light.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、ボードとか少し片付けた方がいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Well then, should we put away some of the stuff like the whiteboard in the room?

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ、いつも通りが良いらしいから。
conversation.en_sentence: It's okay, they want to shoot in our usual setting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 散らかってる研究室じゃなくて良かったね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm relieved that they won't go into the messy lab.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: あー、なんでよりによってその日なんだ、僕出張なのにー！
conversation.en_sentence: Argh, why does it have to be on that day, I'll be gone on a business trip!

conversation.ja_sentence: ピーターソンさん、撮影関係ないでしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: You have nothing to do with shooting, though.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: だって、あのレポーターの女の子、ファンなんだよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm a fan of that reporter girl!

conversation.ja_sentence: お喋りしたいのは分かるけど、みんなあと10分で朝ミーティング、始めるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I know you want to chat a bit more, but we have a morning meeting in 10 minutes, all right?

title: テレビ取材対応について

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、今朝のミーティングはこれくらいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, so that's about it for the morning meeting today?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、あと１点だけ、確認させてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I'd like to confirm one more thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週のテレビ取材ですけど、どのセンサー出すんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: About the TV coverage next week, which sensor are we showing them?

conversation.ja_sentence: 社長は最新のやつ出したがったんだけど...。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, Kentaro wanted to put out the latest ones, but....

conversation.ja_sentence: 静脈認証のはまだテスト完全に終わってないですよ？
conversation.en_sentence: We haven't completed testing for the one with vein authentication yet, you know?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: ウチの３D顔認証の方はまだ開発中だし。
conversation.en_sentence: We're still developing 3D sensors for face recognition, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: だから、今F社のSフォンに乗せてる虹彩認証センサーを見せる事にしたんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: So, we've decided to show our iris authentication sensor currently mounted on F Corporation's S phone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最新のセンサーに関しては、ちょっと最後に話入れるくらいが安全かなって。
conversation.en_sentence: As for our latest sensors, it's probably safer to mention a little at the end of the coverage.

conversation.ja_sentence: ふー、あの指紋認証の時みたいになったらって、心配してたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Phew, I was worried if something went wrong like that time with that fingerprint sensor.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はまだトラウマですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I still carry that trauma, you know?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: あーあれはヤバかった、生放送の番組だったしね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that was chilling, and it was a live show, too!

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、何の話か分からないんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't know what you guys are talking about.

conversation.ja_sentence: 指紋認証、ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: About fingerprint authentication?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、かなり前の話だから三居さんはまだ居なかったかも。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, yeah, it was quite a while ago so maybe you weren't around then, Anna.

conversation.ja_sentence: 10年くらい前でしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: About 10 years ago, I believe?

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、当時ウチが開発したばかりの指紋認証センサー、今回みたいなテレビ番組が取り上げられたんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, like this time, a TV show covered our fingerprint recognition sensor which we had just developed at the time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、生放送の取材中にちゃんと作動しなくてね、その場でフォローも出来なくて。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, it didn't work out properly during the live report, and we couldn't cover for the trouble on the fly either.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、それでこの研究所の評判ガタ落ちして、回復すんのに数年かかったんだ！
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, this lab's reputation took a nosedive then, and we had to spend few years to recover!

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: あの時も大塚社長が一番新しいの出したいって言ったんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Kentaro insisted that he'd show the latest product at the time as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回と違って、説得しきれなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: Unlike this time, I couldn't convince him not to.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、あれは田淵所長がセンサーの使い方も良く知らないのに色々触りまくってたのが大きな要因だよね。
conversation.en_sentence: But I think the big part of it was that Toru fiddled around with the sensor, even though he didn't know much about how to use it.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: あの人、研究所所長っていっても、肩書きだけの元お役人でしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: He's the director of this laboratory, but just a figurehead, a retired official, isn't he?

conversation.ja_sentence: おいおい、言葉に気を付けなさいよ、ピーターソン君。
conversation.en_sentence: Whoa, you should watch your mouth, Ron.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: だって真面目な話、田淵さん色々わかってないプロジェクトにいっつも口出して、迷惑かけるんですもん。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, seriously, he always intervenes in projects he doesn't really understands, and gets us into troubles.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週だって僕のF社でのプレゼン見るって、ついて来たんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Last week too, Toru followed me to see my presentation at F Corporation, though.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: いらん事ばっかり言うから、後から全部細々説明しなきゃいけなくて、スゴく余計な時間かかったんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: He just kept telling them unnecessary things, so I had to spend so much extra time to follow up with explanations for each and every aspect.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、それ私も先月の展示会でやられたわー！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, he did that to me, too, at an exhibition last month!

conversation.ja_sentence: 全部知ってるフリして来場者に話しちゃうでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: He spoke to participants as if he knew everything, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: ずっと気にして横からフォローいれなきゃいけなくて、ほんと疲れた!
conversation.en_sentence: I had to be on the watch and cover for him throughout the event, made me super exhausted!

conversation.ja_sentence: 表に出て話したいなら、もう少し勉強してからにして欲しいよねー。
conversation.en_sentence: He should learn more about our products if he wants to go speak in public.

conversation.ja_sentence: まあまあ、みんなちょっと落ち着いて、そんなに彼を責めないで。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, everybody, calm down a bit, don't be so hard on him.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田淵さんも今度はちゃんとやろうって考えているみたいだから、きっと大丈夫だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Toru is thinking of how he'd do better this time, so he should be okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、ちょっと待ってください、大丈夫って何がですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Wait, wait a sec, what do you mean he'd be okay?

conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、さっき皆話してたでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, you were all talking about it, weren't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: テレビに出るって、田淵さんが。
conversation.en_sentence: About Toru's appearance, on TV.

conversation.ja_sentence: まさか、今回の虹彩認証センサーも田淵所長が出るんじゃあないですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: You're not saying that Toru will be on the show this time with our iris recognition sensor, are you?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、知らなかったの？
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you didn't know?

conversation.ja_sentence: いやいや、それは絶対無理ですって！
conversation.en_sentence: No, no, no, that's definitely impossible!

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: イヤだ、あんな悪夢はもう嫌だー！
conversation.en_sentence: No, way, no more of that nightmare!

conversation.ja_sentence: 所長、今度はラボ全体をトラウマに陥れる気なんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is he trying to traumatize the whole Lab now?

title: 新プロジェクトの初回ミーティング

conversation.ja_sentence: では、本日の会議を始めます。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello everyone, let's get started with today's meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 岡田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Okada.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Nice to meet you all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は第1回目の会議ですので、まずは簡単にそれぞれの自己紹介をしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Since this is our first meeting, let's begin with a quick introduction around the table.

conversation.ja_sentence: その後、私から今回のプロジェクトの概要を簡単にお話しします。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, I am going to give you a brief introduction of our new project.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はこのプロジェクト期間チームを主導させて頂きます。

conversation.ja_sentence: 普段は営業1課におります。
conversation.en_sentence: I normally work at unit one in the Sales Department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何かございましたら、1課のデスクにおりますのでお越しください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please come and talk to me at my desk in unit one, if you have any questions or suggestions.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: It's nice meeting you all today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次に岸田さん、自己紹介をお願いできますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would you like to introduce yourself next, Ms. Kishida?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんはじめまして、岸田です。
conversation.en_sentence: Nice to meet you all, I'm Kishida.

conversation.ja_sentence: 普段は営業2課におります。
conversation.en_sentence: I am at unit two in the Sales Department.

conversation.ja_sentence: みなさんと一緒に働けるのを楽しみにしています。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to working with you all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 岸田さん、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Nice meeting you too, Ms. Kishida.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は宮本です。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Miyamoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: 普段は販売促進部におります。
conversation.en_sentence: I work in the Sales Promotion Department.

conversation.ja_sentence: お二人と共に働けることが楽しみです。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to collaborating with you both.

conversation.ja_sentence: それではこの新プロジェクトの概要について話します。
conversation.en_sentence: We are now going to talk about the outline of this project.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回の新プロジェクトの狙いは我が社の新決済システムの新規利用先の開拓です。
conversation.en_sentence: The new project aims to identify new users for our payment settlement system.

conversation.ja_sentence: さらに、想定できる利用先とは異なる新しい利用者も獲得することが狙いです。
conversation.en_sentence: Furthermore, we are also looking at extending our services to new types of users from our list of sales leads.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい利用者というと？
conversation.en_sentence: What exactly do you mean by new type of users?

conversation.ja_sentence: 良いご質問ですね、通常の小売店や飲食店だけではなくその他にもということです。
conversation.en_sentence: Good question, it means we are aiming to attract not only retail shops or restaurants but also any other potential opportunities.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok.

conversation.ja_sentence: 様々な利用先を獲得したいということですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We want to get various type of users.

conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: だからそれぞれ違う営業部署や担当からプロジェクトチームが構成されたんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's why our team comprises different sales departments and divisions.

conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 各部署や各課での営業スタイルは違うと思いますが、それが強みになります。
conversation.en_sentence: Each department or unit has a different marketing strategy, and that would be our strength.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 是非、このプロジェクトを成功させましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's make this project a success.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、一緒に頑張りましょう！
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, let's try our best!

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん数値目標があるのですが、その点については次回詳しく説明します。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course we will have a revenue target, but we will go into that more in our next meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえず、今日は時間があまりないので終わります。
conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, we should close the meeting here as we are running out of time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次回の会議スケジュールと資料を後程Eメールでお送りします。

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、承知致しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, noted.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please.

title: 学生が海外に送る貨物に関する大学事務員の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: カナさん、ちょっとお聞きしていいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Kana, can I ask you something?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本に船便で身の回り品を送りたいと言っている学生さんがいるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: There is a student who wants to send his personal belongings to Japan by sea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来月出国予定で、昨日事務所に質問に来ました。
conversation.en_sentence: He's leaving the country next month, and he came to the office yesterday asking for advice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 普段荷物を送るのにはY社を使っていると思うんですが、今朝電話で見積もりをお願いしたら1000ポンド以上かかると言われたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand that we usually use Company Y for the shipment, but when I called them this morning to get a quote, they basically told me it would cost more than 1000 pounds.

conversation.ja_sentence: 学生さんの予算をかなりオーバーしているので、他のやり方がないか探しているんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Since that is way out of his budget, I am trying to find other ways of doing it.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: Right.

conversation.ja_sentence: Y社は手続きを一つのパッケージプランでやってくれるから便利なんだけど、その分ちょっと割高になりがちなんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Company Y offers the service as one whole package, and while it is very convenient, it tends to be a bit overpriced.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし自分たちで国内の船会社と、日本で通関業者と運送会社をそれぞれ見つけられれば合計の費用は安く済むはず。
conversation.en_sentence: If we can find a shipping company here, and a custom broker and a delivery company in Japan separately by ourselves the total fee should be cheaper.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何年か前に同じような案件があったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We had a similar case a few years ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かここに記録があったような、ちょっと待ってね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think I can find the record here, give me a sec.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: あった。
conversation.en_sentence: Here it is.

conversation.ja_sentence: 貨物の引き取りと日本の港への送付はW社にお願いして、税関業務はE社にお願いして、そしたら輸送もE社が手配してくれているね。
conversation.en_sentence: We asked Company W to collect the cargo and ship to the Japanese Port in Tokyo, then for the custom paperwork we asked Company E and they arranged the delivery for us as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 費用は全部で500ポンド。
conversation.en_sentence: The total fee was 500 pounds.

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、費用の部分は貨物のサイズや重量と、あと内容物の価値によって変わってくる。
conversation.en_sentence: Obviously, the fee will change depending on the size and the weight of the cargo as well as the value of the contents.

conversation.ja_sentence: この時には関税はかからないですんだから良かった。
conversation.en_sentence: We could avoid getting any custom charge for this case, so that was good.

conversation.ja_sentence: その学生さんはどのぐらいの量送ろうと思ってるのかな？
conversation.en_sentence: How much stuff is he going to send?

conversation.ja_sentence: この方と同じぐらいの量のはずです。
conversation.en_sentence: It should be about the same as hers.

conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、まあもちろん全く同じ金額になるとは限らないけど、今回も前回と同じように進めていいと思う。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, well obviously we shouldn't expect it to be exactly the same, but I'd say we can do it in the same way this time.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、W社に電話します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I will call Company W.

conversation.ja_sentence: 荷物のだいたいの量と内容の価値を聞かれると思うから、学生さんに先に確認した方がいいかもね。
conversation.en_sentence: They would need a rough amount of the package and a value of the contents so maybe check with the student first.

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: メールします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will email him.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、W社はもしかしたらCMSを導入したかもしれないから、聞いておいた方がいいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, also Company W may have introduced CMS so check that with them too.

conversation.ja_sentence: CMSって何ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What is CMS?

conversation.ja_sentence: 「コンテナー・マネジメント・サーチャージ」っていうんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It's "container management surcharge".

conversation.ja_sentence: 実際ちゃんとした費用なのかはわからない部分もあるんだけど、船会社によっては港で荷下ろしするときに通関業者に請求する所があるみたいなんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: It is a little unclear if that is really a thing, but some shipping companies charge the broker when they unload the cargos at the port.

conversation.ja_sentence: 手数料みたいなものかな。
conversation.en_sentence: It's like a handling fee.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 前回W社からは請求されなかったから、今回も同じだといいんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Company W did not charge us the last time so hopefully it still is the case.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.

conversation.ja_sentence: 前の時のファイルを送っていただいてもいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you to send me the file of the previous case?

conversation.ja_sentence: 目を通したいです。
conversation.en_sentence: I want to go through it.

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: というか、匿名にして共有のデータベースにあげておくね。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I am going to make it anonymous and upload it on our shared database.

conversation.ja_sentence: これからも同じような案件が出てくるかもしれないし。
conversation.en_sentence: We may have similar cases in the future.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!

conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。
conversation.en_sentence: You're welcome.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンのお手伝いをしてくださるそうで、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for offering to help me with my presentation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は今回のように大勢の前でプレゼンしたことがないんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I've never given a presentation in front of such big audience before.

conversation.ja_sentence: お手伝いできて嬉しいです！
conversation.en_sentence: I'm glad I could help!

conversation.ja_sentence: どんなプレゼンにするつもりですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What are you planning?

conversation.ja_sentence: スライドショーをしようかと考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm thinking about using a slide show.

conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の購買層を示すのには円グラフが良いですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll probably include a pie chart showing our demographic.

conversation.ja_sentence: そして地域別の販売高を示すのに棒グラフを使おうと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I'll use a bar graph to show our numbers for each region.

conversation.ja_sentence: グラフはただ見せるより説明した方が良いですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I would suggest explaining the graph rather than just showing.

conversation.ja_sentence: それぞれの座標軸がなにを意味するのか忘れずに指し示してくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to point out what each axis means.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうすれば、あなたが説明したいことを皆さんが確実に理解してくれます。
conversation.en_sentence: That way, you can make sure everyone understands what you're trying to show.

conversation.ja_sentence: それから、グラフの各領域の色を目立つようにすること。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, make sure the colors between the sections of the graph stand out easily.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、あまり派手すぎないように。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't make it too fancy, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: ごくシンプルにした方が良いですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's better to keep it pretty simple.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい！
conversation.en_sentence: Okay!

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: That makes sense.

conversation.ja_sentence: この題目はどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How does this theme look?

conversation.ja_sentence: これはちょっと複雑すぎますね。
conversation.en_sentence: That one is a bit too complicated.

conversation.ja_sentence: 表示の内容が読みにくいです。
conversation.en_sentence: It's hard to read what the labels say.

conversation.ja_sentence: 代わりにこうしてみたら良いと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think you should try this one instead.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼン自体についてなにか秘訣はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any tips for the actual presentation?

conversation.ja_sentence: 事前に何度か練習することでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: I would say practice a few times before.

conversation.ja_sentence: 前日に練習してストレスを感じるより、何日か余裕を持って練習したほうが良いですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Space out your practice between a few days, so you won't be too stressed by practicing on the last day.

conversation.ja_sentence: ナーバスになりすぎず、ホワイトボードを見ずに会場を見渡すようにすること。
conversation.en_sentence: Just don't be too nervous, and make sure to look around the room rather than at the white board.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンを暗記すればするほど、簡単に皆さんと目線を合わせられるようになりますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: The more you have your presentation memorized, the easier it will be to make eye contact with people.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと練習します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll be sure to practice.

conversation.ja_sentence: その点を一番心配しているんです。
conversation.en_sentence: That's the part I'm most worried about.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご協力ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your help!

conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: 上手く行きますように！
conversation.en_sentence: Good luck!
